title: Waste of money and zero support
text:
I purchased ths item for my husband, I already use their scale. I have multiple problems, the first of which is that their customer support is next to nothing. When they can’t fob you off with stock, copy and paste, replies and they stick with it long enough to actually read your problems, well, then you are not any better off. I’ve long since abandoned the use of the blood pressure monitor, since it is quite useless for the purpose it was purchased, taking blood pressure and recording it wirelessly.
Simply does not work. 
Now the scale has been successful in weighing us both. Unfortunately, it has no ability to differentiate between people who are close to the same weight, like my husband and I, even though I always select my name at weighing. Again, after constant effort to attempt to get customer service, they just stopped communicating with me. I guess customer service is not their thing once they have your money. 
Now the app has removed the week display, or should I say, it’s gone from mine, I’m trying customer service again today but I’m quite honestly very much less than optimistic that I will have my problems addresses anytime soon, if at all. 
There’s lots of products on the market that do what these items are ‘supposed’ to do. Vote with you feet and walk away from Nokia/Withings products and save yourself the headaches I’ve been through.

title: I personally love the new app.
text: I don’t normally write reviews, but in light of the harsh criticisms of the new app and its functionality I would like to share my experiences as a long time Withings and now Nokia customer.  I disagree with some of the opinions of others regarding the new app.  I went into it with an open mind (after the initial worry when I saw it was “new”) and after using it now for a while have discovered it is better in many ways.  The app is easier to navigate, it is in fact more intuitive to use not less.  Even though I appreciated many of the features of the previous app (some of which ARE missing from the current app), I find the new app much easier to navigate.  I also find the summary pages easier to find information on as well as easier on the eyes.  Nokia is a company who has been around for decades, they haven’t stayed in business by producing irrelevant products or ignoring their customers (I don’t work for them, I work in the medical field).  So instead of flambéing them on the reviews, settle down, email them with suggestions and have some patience.  Just my two cents, carry on...

title: Great Idea, needs some work
text: I adore this product for its sleek lines how easy it is to use and how it looks when I’m wearing it. Yes, it counts steps lower then other step counters but I am just looking for a baseline and day to day progress so once I had a month in that wasn’t an issue. My reason for choosing the model I did the Steel HR was for heart rate and sleep tracking and here is where I am constantly feeling somewhat disappointed. I love this feature and the HR monitoring seems to do well. The sleep tracker however needs some major improvements, when it’s working it’s fantastic but you can’t really track sleep if it doesn’t even pick up you’ve slept 2 or 3 nights a week OR doesn’t record sleep activity until after the first time you’ve gotten out of bed to use the bathroom at 2 am. I’ve looked at all the fixes and reasons this might occur and none of them make sense to me. I don’t shake my arm wildly after I get into bed and often wake 3-4 hours after going to sleep in the same position I fell asleep, yet the tracker does not record. More frustrating is when it fails to record a night at all. It keeps record of my sleep heart rate, why is it not giving me sleep data? So I love it’s sleek design, it’s exercise features, and much of what they are trying to do but it’s more a a parlor game then a health gadget at this time. It does have a clock and the ability to get notifications is a huge plus. Fix the sleep tracking and it’d be a 5 star.

title: Don’t buy the blood pressure cuff
text:
This was a good app and blood pressure monitor when it was originally released. The new owners have turned the blood pressure cuff into a brick. I’ve lost over a year of health data because of the “updates”. The most recent update resulted in the app no longer recognizing a device I’ve been using for over a year. The app also now requires the user to create an account and to share health data with them. This is frankly another ignorant move to try to collect used data to use for marketing. This is no longer a health app for that reason. Save yourself some money and privacy and buy the simple blood pressure monitor from your local pharmacy. One that just uses batteries instead of you’d private information.

Update: a customer service person responded to this review promptly. The response included an apology. However the response did NOT include a solution. If Nokia can’t offer a solution I want a refund. The device stopped working because of a forced update that Nokia sent out.

Update: I contacted Withings customer service by email and requested a full refund. Withings responded by saying they will only warranty for 30 days. Even if they make the device useless due to their failure they will not refund the purchase. They are very stubborn and just thank you for your patience. Once they get your money that’s all they want. Save yourself a lot of money and buy the stand alone blood pressure device you can get from your local pharmacy.

title: Inconsistent UI, but not many do better
text:
It’s an average app, for what it is meant to do.  Data collection and presentation are at the core of the product.  Unfortunately, the app tries to hard to make data relevant, and becomes inconsistent across the experience.  Want to see your aggregate sleep for the week?  Awesome!  Now try to go back to the screen you were on.  The UI sometimes choose to provide no way of going back.  So, then your only choice is to exit the app and start over.  Want to rotate the app?  Cool...that will work, sometimes.  Other times it’s like fighting with an obstinate spouse.  Not happening unless it wants to make it happen.  Useful things like, average REM sleep are missing (or possibly buried so that can’t find it easily). This app desperately needs sparklines to be extended to many categories, and I should be able to choose which categories, in my dashboard.  The weight, steps and sleep sparklines are great.  Why not use them in a daily snapshot that represents the last week, in one dashboard view that also shows the other things that are already being captured?  It’s the inconsistency that is holding this app back.  
BTW, this the kind of rating and review that happens when a popup requests my feedback in the middle of me just trying to go about my daily review routine.  Stop doing it, no one likes it.

title: Updated: So much better than used it to be
text:
Update 1/1/19: this is more of a feature request than a review: i often find myself wishing there was a current weather screen on the steel hr. the current weather (within a configurable interval) could be pushed when that particular screen is viewed. could eventually be expanded to included forecasts for the next few hours. 

Updated Review: After following the link in the developer response, i learned that health mate will only show an app in its notifications list, if the app pushed a notification while health mate was running in the background. this is why i never saw google calendar as an option for watch notifications. this isn’t very intuitive; i would suggest adding help text that explains this. Still a good app tho!

Original Review: The new notification and on-watch workout selection systems are game changers for the steel hr. Kudos to the deva for delivering these features. I just have a few minor quibbles: 1) no google calendar notifications. 2) the new workout mode continuously shows the elapsed time in full brightness instead on-demand check ins. 3) it would also be nice to see a summary (elapsed time, avg and peak hr, etc) when you complete a workout. Keep up the good work!

title: Like the watch and app
text:
This has been a great investment for my personal program of activity. I am 55 and interested in monitoring my activity. A great feature of this watch and app has been monitoring my sleep patterns and blood pressure. I have been researching how to get better sleep patterns with diet and exercise factors. 
I like the fact that the alarm on my watch vibrates to wake me up to get to Crossfit class without waking my wife. I looked at many options when trying to find a device that would help track mostly my sleep patterns. I am working with my physician in also trying to monitor oxygen levels and other factors. 
I like the feature that Nokia has of measuring steps taken in a day with the smaller dial. It helps motivate me to walk more. Also, like the feature where I activate the watch at the start of my workout and end it at the end of the workout.
In my opinion, this is a great addition to a good fitness program. It is helping me find a good sleep routine to make the best of my overall daily fitness.

title: Setup is a negative but it gets better
text:
Set up is not a good experience- lots of glitches and warning signs ( why do I have to keep entering my Apple ID? What do you mean “payment processed?). I wanted a scale. I do not want advertisements for sleep trackers etc. and drivel passing as insights (Did I know weight is important?  Actually, yes: why do you think I got this scale?).   I have gotten the family set up on the scale (relatively painless) but my wife can’t get it to talk to her phone. 

I wish the developers would just focus on weighing us and communicating with a smart phone over Bluetooth. I don’t want an account and another password. I would like the displays simplified so you can see weight over time (with dates) and maybe other parameters on their own page. The app tries to squeeze way too much onto the screen of an iPhone. 

As for the scale, it is quite sensitive but not stable. I stand there watching it flip tenth of a pound digits so long that sometimes the scale shuts down without a reading. A little signal filtering would help. Also, the percent body fat is all over the map (I doubt it fluctuates by more that 1% day to day).  But I do like the display and being ableto track   progress.

title: Frustrated
text:
I’ve had the app for years. I used it to monitor my steps years before Apple Heath and Apple Watch. I eventually purchased the scale, blood pressure monitor, & most recently, the sleep tracker app. Recently, I started receiving multiple weight measurements every day. I noticed that whenever I opened the app a new weight measurement would appear even if I hadn’t stepped on the scale that day. So I contacted support. I was asked to provide a considerable amount of information, which I happily did as I assumed it would lead to my problem being resolved more quickly. Unfortunately, that’s not what happened. Here is the response I received, “Our development team is aware of the loop effect which is causing this issue to take place (HM → other app → AH → HM).

I do apologize however, we do not have a planned fix, we recommend users only export from Apple Health.“ 

My reply was that their response was unacceptable as according to the description in the App Store at the time was that the app “plays well with others” (in all caps).  I was assured that my concerns would be forwarded to the development team. This was On May 13th. Apparently my concerns aren’t worth much as I haven’t  heard from anyone & it’s now the end of May.

title: Getting worse over time
text:
This app has been on my phone for several years. The last few updates have seen a nosedive in quality.
First, the app now requires multiple authentications before opening if you have passcode access on. Inconvenient, but not a dealbreaker. Then, the app started adding phantom steps when the phone was charging. It’d add steps at a constant rate during times when the phone, and any step counters, were stationary, at a fixed rate (usually 270 steps/hour). When attempting to shut off step counting in the app, I found it was no longer possible - and when I contacted support about it, I had to send them screenshots from my app to prove to them the option was missing. Support was unable to help, so eventually I just removed the app’s permission to write steps to Apple health at the OS level. I updated today hoping they’d been addressing these issues but now it’s no longer even *importing* step data from the Apple health app (it cuts off right at the time I updated!)
I hope the developer can successfully address these issues. I really like their health hardware, and the software, until about six months ago, has been rock solid. But if it continues in this fashion I’m not going to have any use at all for it.

title: Make sleep score optional
text:
I am such a fan of and very grateful for my Withings watch and app. It has been a great support for me to understand my sleep so I can identify how deep I’m sleeping as a vital element of my health during some trying, long-term health challenges. 

This 1 star review is not for the watch/app overall, it is for the sleep score update. I find it very damaging to rate the quality of our sleep on a point system of 1-100, most especially the negative evaluations of each element of sleep. Examples of these are: 

“Sleep score 20. Depth= Bad.”

“2hrs 6mins isn’t much...try to sleep a little longer tonight.” Next to a bright orange exclamation point. 

“OK, so, it’s time to bring sleep back into your life.” Next to a bright red exclamation point. 

“Your bed and rise times diverge too much from those of these last few days.” Next to a bring red exclamation point. (This was a night I slept well and long.)

As if I don’t already feel the weight of my lack of sleep and it’s negative reflection on my health challenges. As if I don’t already feel stressed and even grieved about the harsh reality of being unable to sleep well. As if I should “Just try harder! Just do better!” As if we don’t get this message enough in every other area of life. 

They need to make these CRITICAL COMMENTS OPTIONAL. Make the sleep NEGATIVE SCORE OPTIONAL. 

Sleep is valuable and clearly we want POSITIVE SUPPORT about it. 

Thank you for your care and attempted support.

title: This app is the Mercedes in it’s industry!!!
text:
A little more than a year ago I wanted a hybrid watch to track my activity and I started my searching Journey for a perfect product which would be a device and supporting application. I started trying hybrid smartwatches with their respective health app like Skagen, Michael Kors, Fitbit, Garmin, Suunto and many of the products were good but the health apps that supports them were not, till I came across the Withings which became Nokia and now Withings again. When I tried hybrid watch steel HR with its health app I was amazed, it simply speaks my language :)
I have been using this app with watch for a little over a year now and I must say I am impressed by design, functionality and practicality of it. Step, sleep, activity, Heartbeat tracking, they all are displayed on one screen with Minimalistic looks,  and yet not cluttered and confusing like other competitors. This is exactly what I wanted and it delivers the way I like it, so I give 5 STARS!!!

title: Useful app, responsive developer
text:
I have a BPM Connect BP monitor and a Smart Body Analyzer scale that I use daily. I’ve had the scale for years and am very pleased with it (although I can’t use it in a humid bathroom because it changes units and I have no idea what a stone pound is!). The BP monitor is also working well 6 months in. 

Well, I started experiencing a crash (when clicking into the BP history) in this app early this year. Eventually in June got annoyed enough to open a ticket with Withings support. Finally today in October it’s been fixed! Withings support was quite attentive, checking in every couple of weeks, but not in an annoying “please check if it still occurs” kind of way.  It felt like a long time to wait for a fix but four months is really pretty good for a nuisance with a minor impact to me. Many developers wouldn’t even bother to respond in a case like this. So thanks, Withings, and cheers!

title: Former success on WW, love Lose it
text: I’m very pleased with what I’ve experienced thus far. On WW, I focused on recording everything I ate, exercised vigorously and lost 60 lbs. 6 years later, after a heart valve replacement, the weight returned.  Now that I’m feeling better the nutritionist at cardio rehab suggested this. Because I’m a competitive spirit, and a numbers guy, I got a fit bit and even a smart scale to assist me. Although only 2weeks into it, already down 7 lbs, I really am pleased. Monitoring levels of nutrients, calories, and everything else allows me the opportunity to understand what foods provide proper balance. I’ve increased my fiber intake, while reducing carbs and sugar, but right now I’m focusing on dropping my sodium levels. I truly am impressed with the easy to use technology. My blood pressure has improved, I’m feeling good and seem to have more energy.  Very useful tool, glad to recommend. 5 Stars!

title: Useful but buggy
text:
I enjoy using this with my HR Steel but I’ve noticed some weird UI issues. It has yet to learn that I do not swim. I do not swim. I do not swim. I always select ‘fitness’ when I do circuit training. I circuit train, walk, and occasionally run. Yet it continues to insist that I swim. It has asked me twice if it was right, both times I said no and selected fitness. It still says I’m swimming. Very annoying. 

Secondly, the UI looks poor on iPhone X. ‘Synchronizing’ message is cut off at the top, it somehow appears above the native UI navigation (to go back to the previous app/search), and the toggles do not reach the bottom of the display which would fix the UI issue. Strange that I’ve had no issues with other major apps in this regard, just this one. 

Please fix the darn watch insisting that I’m swimming. Fix it so it actually learns and stops auto-selecting what I’m doing when I’ve told it countless times what I am actually doing.

title: Best health app available!
text: I purchased a Withings watch primarily because of the looks, but I still wanted to track steps and general activity. I have owned an Apple Watch, Fitbit and Halo and in the end just couldn’t keep an athletic looking watch on my wrist day ina me day out. And the apps were nothing special with those. Hands down this is the most educational, interactive, clean interface and easy to use of all available. I am continually blown away by the content they are providing. It is similar to an app our company PAYS for to provide this sort of content to help keep employees healthy. Love love LOVE my watch and if possible, love it even MORE because of this app. It is now an indispensable part of my life and I say that without regrets.  I have never written an app review. But I literally get so excited about this one that I had to…and to thank the developers for a job well done!

title: BP trend is stubborn
text:
Using the BP trend graph is like Snoopy trying to wrestle with the lawn chair at Thanksgiving. Please let me pinch zoom and horizontally slide to view the range of dates that I want to see. Quit snapping it to strict weeks or months. I was discharged from the hospital toward the end of last month. I want to take a screenshot of my BP trend since then, with the last reading selected and annotated with the raw numbers. This stupid trend graph won’t let me view all my numbers on one screen, because they don’t fit into a single week or month. Moronic.

The temperature input controls are vertically reversed from the rest. Confusing. For BP and weight, the bigger numbers are below. But for temperature the bigger numbers are above.  Seriously?  Suggestion: make the vertical direction consistent across all inputs. Don’t most people think about bigger numbers being above smaller numbers?  Maybe this is a UI conspiracy to force me to buy expensive blue tooth health devices.

title: Recent updates are awesome
text:
I was a long time Withings scale user when it was acquired by Nokia and this app was created. I used a combination of this app, IFTTT and Apple Heath to export my weight data to an app I liked better for weight tracking. I basically never bothered opening this app because it didn’t have any data I was interested in. 

I recently had to replace my smart scale and just connected the new one today. I’m frankly amazed at how useful this app finally is! It imported so much great data from Apple Health — steps, average heart rate (I have an Apple Watch), etc. Plus, the weight charts have a line that averages out daily weigh ins to more easily show you your weight trends.

I feel like a lot of what I missed out on from moving from a Fitbit tracker to Apple Watch is back within my grasp. Very pleasantly surprised! Looking forward to using this app to stay motivated regarding health.

title: Good App
text: It tracks all your data really well and pretty much forever; just slide back and forth with finger. A bit slow starting after pressing button on BP cuff. The Notes has a bug: first text entered is often lost after tapping check mark to accept it and has to be re-entered. Great for gathering a lot of statistical long-term data on blood pressure, which helps to manage it better, find out what works in controlling BP. The coin slot for the battery compartment: it’s unnecessarily wide and the plastic is somewhat soft, so it erodes and then it becomes difficult to open and close using a coin as intended. When the battery gets below 70% ‘Measurement Error’ happens more often and when it gets to about 60% it may become inaccurate. The battery life is reasonably good before it gets down to 70% where performance starts to suffer.

title: Long Term User = Long term satisfaction
text:
My wife & I have been using the wireless blood pressure (BP) cuff for several years. We each use it on a different iPhone (we update phone’s yearly). The BP unit has worked with all of our phones and we are able to keep our own BP records on our individual phones. The WBP iApp is constantly updated by the company with new features and weeding out any small flaws that may show up.
My wife had a heart stoppage event several years ago (that’s when we got the WBP cuff & I recently had a stroke. 
➡️TIP: look up the acronym “BEFAST” in connection w/stroke - it may save a life.
Fortunately we both fully recovered. Being able to keep a daily record of our BP along with daily heart rates via Apples iWatch, our doctors are able to check and see how we are doing over time, rather than just when we go for an office visit. The WBP readings help give us a piece of mind on how we are doing over time. Armed with this knowledge, if we have any issues in the future then we can be proactive and follow up right away rather than wait for our next check up. 
The WBP cuff and software has worked flawlessly for us. I can’t comment re support as we have never needed any. 
Again PLEASE LOOK UP  “BEFAST” and the life you save may be your own.

title: Don’t like recent update
text:
In general I am quite satisfied with this app. I’ve been using it for years with my Withings corded BP cuff. Just plug it in, let it do it’s thing, then review your results and look at your graph. All very good.

However, I do not like the changes you have made to the color coded BP ranges. I realize that guidelines on BP may have been relaxed somewhat. However as I have high BP and am on meds I like to keep a close eye on it and have strict standards for myself. I do not like that the “Elevated” range is now coded with green rather than yellow. I want to be visually alerted if my results go outside the “Normal” range. Perhaps allow the user to modify the colors? Your development team apparently forgot to change the colors displayed on the timeline, so we have inconsistent color coding from one screen to another!

As others have commented, it is disappointing that the app can not adjust to portrait mode (other apps are able to deal with this).

title: Great concept, good execution
text: I have the Steel HR Sport watch and I really like its simplicity of design. Since I have my phone with me most of the time I don't need a second even smaller computer on my wrist, so I think the trade off between seriously excellent battery life (plus better looks) is well worth giving up bells & whistles I already have on the phone. The Health Mate app is well integrated and works well. My only complaint is that Withings support is slow and poor. I'm the type of person who reads the manual, looks at all the online forums, and only then when I still can't find the answer do I contact support. So I had a question about whether the Fitness Score can only be generated from a run (rather than, say, a swim) and after a long delay support comes back with boilerplate I'd already read in the manual which says nothing about my question. Slow and poor.

title: Elevation/Flights Climbed Issue
text:
Overall I do like this app and the devices that I have purchased that sync with it (the Withings Scale and Blood Pressure Monitor). The scale doesn’t always sync with the app and sometimes I would have to re-enter my WiFi password to get it to sync again but that’s not a big issue.

My one major complaint about the app is the detection of elevation/flights climbed feature. It requires that I get a specific watch from Withings that detects altimeter, instead of allowing it to access that information from my Apple Watch or the iPhone Health app. Would someone respond and let me know if this is something that can be done or would I just have to go without? An answer would be greatly appreciated. If it’s possible to sync it from my watch at some point, that would motivate me to change my review from a 4-star to a 5-star. Thank you.

title: Cuff and app work fine together but one enhancement would take it to the next level
text:
Update: the developer reached out and explained how to get the data into the apple Health app so everything works great now!  It was easy to do - just not exactly how I thought it would be done.  The health stuff is all new to me so definitely a learning curve on my part. Changing rating from 4 to 5 stars. 

Original: Overall, I’m very happy with the cuff I bought and the app. It seems like a recent update helped the cuff pair with the app faster which resolved what would have been my only real complaint.  One enhancement that would be wonderful is to have the app write the BP results directly into the apple health app like so many other health related apps do.  I like having all my health stuff in one place, the health app, so it’s an added step every morning.

title: Some good and some bad
text:
It works well with the BP cuff most of the time. It is linked with bluetooth, but sometimes it is very slow at transferring the data to the app on my phone. Sometimes it never transfers so I have to pay close attention after the third measurement to see it as it scrolls through on the cuff so I can write it down. I also can’t figure out how to change the settings so it will only take my BP one time as
apposed  to  three times and using the average. 
The other bad part is the scale we bought is supposed to have all of these cool features and link to the via bluetooth just like the BP cuff does. However I can’t figure out how to access the settings and enable the different features and it will not pair to my phone’s bluetooth. 
I’m very frustrated and I’m not sure if the goods out weigh the beads at this point. I love the idea of these devices and their capabilities, I just want them to be a reality as well.

title: Info  doesn’t show consistently on scale
text: What started out as a great product has evolved into just an okay product. It is not consistent in the information that it provides through the scale.   Sometimes it shows steps, sometimes it doesn’t, sometimes it shows heart rate , sometimes it doesn’t.   After multiple times of being asked by a tech to update the scale by reconnecting to Wi-Fi, install fresh batteries, restart, try a different location ,  and delete then reinstall app on phone, I’ve come to the conclusion that it may work, or it may not work and the only way that I’ll get the correct information when I’m supposed to, is to buy a new scale.   I’m not going to buy a new scale and I’m not going to recommend the product unless all a person wants is their weight, the weather forecast and the temperature in the location where the scale is located.   I don’t know why there’s is a debug information screen in the app since there is no way to debug my scale.

title: No True iPadOS Support
text: This review is for the iPadOS version of the HealthMate App (I would rate the iOS / iPhone version higher). I use my iPad in landscape mode virtually all the time, my iPad case facilitates this, the charging port is on the side as to not interfere with this, the ~ 4x3 aspect ratio is most efficient in landscape. In short I have no use for Apps on my iPad that do not support Landscape mode. I don’t care what features they have, if the developer is too lazy or too cheap to support iPadOS landscape mode (and properly take advantage of the space), I delete the App from my iPad, which is what I have done with the HealthMate App. This is unfortunate because I use my iPad far more than my iPhone, and when reviewing my weight, heart rate, fat ratio and other information, the iPad in landscape would be my device of choice (FYI I have a Withings scale and years of data). The predecessor to the HealthMate App (Withings) allowed Landscape, if HealthMate ever adds this capability, I would use it and my rating would be higher.

title: Still no way to delete steps data.
text:
We used this app for the scale, and it was fine. However, I recently got a new phone, and somehow in the process of setting up my new phone, my steps data from the Apple Health app got imported to the HealthMate app. After unsuccessfully trying several things on my own to remove the data, I went to the Withings support forums. 

It turns out others had the same problem, and gave feedback that they wanted this functionality added. I was dismayed to find that the company still hadn’t addressed this, given that some of these comments were over a year old.

I deleted my account, as it seems like the only way to remove the unwanted steps data. I wrote to customer support, explaining what happened, and asked why they have not given us customers a way to delete steps data. I received a generic response from customer service, confirming that there is no way to delete steps data at this time, and they’re working to improve the app all the time... nothing to answer why we can’t delete steps data, and nothing specifically about whether or not they are even trying to add this function to the app. I really feel as though I never actually got a response.

We really like the concept of all these health tools and the apps that go with them, but it is really off-putting when the company doesn’t seem to care about what their customers want or need.

title: Great add on app!
text: Really enjoy this app as well as the Apple health app. I am new to the Withings family and I can say I absolutely love the products! They work flawlessly with my Apple health app as well as the health mate app! I own the blood pressure monitor and the body+ scales, and these did such a fantastic job that I purchased the sleep mat as well as Thermo and they should be here within the week!! I owned the ihealth scales and blood pressure cuff which recently quit working on me. That’s how I found the Withings product name and I’m sure glad I did! The readings are more consistent with the Withings I’d say as well connect much easier for me. The ihealth would connect but sometimes it would require me to power the unit off and back on, it wasn’t bad but still find the Withings much easier. Thanks for the great products Withings!!

title: Wish it had a notification sound
text:
I enjoy the layout of the app. I used to have a WeightGuru scale and the app was a little lack luster when it came to trying to look at progress. I only switched to this scale (Body+) for an upgrade and thinking it being wifi was going to be faster?/better. (The WeightGuru scale I had to take a picture of the barcode for it to scan into the app) 

With this scale it feels like it takes forever to load the weight and specs. I can stand on the scale for 30 second to three minutes and it will still be deciding what my weight is. There’s no chime from the scale, which I knew buying it, or from the app to know when it has completed the weigh-in.

Besides that, I do like the layout of the app, I enjoy that it has cross platform with MyFitness pal for nutrition. And that it sends the data over to AppleHealth as well

title: Works well except for Apple health sync
text: I have this app for use with my sleep tracking mat and without talking about the hardware this app works well. It gives me all the data the accessory collects and even a few aggregate views. My main gripe is how inconsistent the syncing is Apple health. I like to sync my sleep so I can view it on the health app get notifications about trends on my Apple Watch and feed the data to other apps, but half of the time the sleep data in health is not the same as the one in this app, which is frustrating as there’s no way to force an update or re-sync. What’s more sometimes I will see the data was synced correctly, only to be botched up later in the day. If this bug wasn’t a thing I would say this app is great does exactly what I want it to do well 5 stars, but that issue has been a thing for months and it’s irritating.

title: Varies from day to day
text:
I have the Body+ scale for a week. I am on the Keto diet using MyNetDiary as the accompanying app for nutrition. I weigh myself daily first thing in the morning before I eat or drink anything. The weight shows a steady decline daily but the body fat calculation swing high to low on a daily basis. I am a male, 5’10”, 154 pounds, and the body fat percentage swings from 11.5% to 12.5% depending on the day. I can step on the scale, get a reading, wait a minute or two and take another reading and it’s different, the weight is the same but the body fat changes. I am careful to center myself using the 4 arrows in the corners. The scale is on a tile floor sitting in the center of a 20” tile, without the carpet feet attached to it. 
So what is goofed up, the scale or the app?
I like it but have doubts about its accuracy..

title: It works well enough
text:
I like the scale which is easy to use. I like that the app keeps track of everything so I don’t have to write it down or figure out my own trends. It’s nice to see my weight graphed out for me. 
The scale it’s self works very well on a hard floor and it comes with little feet you can install so it can be used on carpet. PROBLEM is that it is 20 pounds off when used on carpet even with the feet installed. I’m REALLY bummed about that because I don’t have room in my bathroom for it to sit on the floor. I either have to put it away in the cabinet (guarantees I will forget to do my daily weigh in 50% of the time) or I have to put it in the bedroom and move it out to the bathroom every day. I’m super disappointed with that. 

Overall it is a good tracking app and seems to be an accurate scale (only on hard surfaces) and gets done what it needs to.

title: Withings Steel HR
text:
I’ve had the Steel HR (white face) 14 days so far. 
The styling is well done. 
The silicon band is very supple and comfortable. 
Color of the housing is spot on. 
The sleep app (Health Mate) is for the most part fairly accurate although some nights it doesn’t start until hours later. Thankfully I can manually edit the start/stop times. 

IMPROVEMENTS
The numbers on the face should be bolder to make them easier to read. The minute hand doesn’t quite line up with the marks. 
The hands are elegant but could be a little wider to make reading them easier. 
I did have some problems setting up the sync with my iPhone 6S but made a few adjustments on my iPhone settings regarding notifications and now it syncs well. 

Overall I do enjoy the smart watch and believe it’s a good buy for those people who enjoy seeing an analog face AND having some digital features.

8-2-19  Update. 17 days
After multiple failures of sleep monitoring and failures of various notifications (texts and emails) I am returning the smart watch.
8-4-19
I thought I should add this. I can’t confirm it but I believe the addition of the Health Mate program to my iPhone seemed to deplete the iPhone battery. Since removing the Health Mate program from my iPhone the battery does not appear to decrease in strength at the dramatic rate it did when the Health Mate program was installed.

title: A big step backward.
text:
This new app is terrible. I can no longer set 2 alarms on my Aura. The interface is not nearly as user friendly. I'm not sure what you were thinking when you released this, but I would say you need more beta testing. Such a huge disappointment.

Updated 8/30:  Sorry to be a buzzkill there Jason, but alarms still do not work properly.  I set an alarm and everything looks good.  Close the app, reopen it and everything still looks good.  Alarm never goes off.  Open the app and the alarms have reverted to the previous settings.  This is not good.  If you guys can't figure out a way to fix the functionality that was working just fine before you launched the new app, you should get out of the game.  Just so disappointed.

Updated 5/1/20: I think I wrote that review a couple of years ago and the alarm issue is still not fixed. Pretty unbelievable.

Update 8/7/20: I don’t know why you guys “fix” the parts of the app that aren’t broken, but it now takes an extra click to get to the timeline. As inaccurate as that information has become over the past year, it’s still the data that I’m interested in, not the app’s “insights”. Also, what happened to the heart rate information?  It used to display in the timeline (both awake and asleep averages) but it doesn’t anymore. What gives? 

I’m just about through with this app and all the related accessories. None of them work as well since the app was “improved”.

title: Improved indeed, but still no wow factor
text: Like so many other users, I deeply resented having the Nokia version of the former Withings app jammed down my throat against my will. A classic example of a big company treating the users of a business they acquired very poorly and expecting them to get over it. The new app started out as a stain on Nokia and an insult to Withings users. It has improved, but still demonstrates unconscionable arrogance by wiping out all back data for weight and heart rate before their June 2017 forced conversion. The whole point of buying a smart scale is be able to easily track long term trends. Not converting the measures people paid for, like Weight and Heart Rate make users think Nokia is incompetent and does not understand the user base they bought into. Please please fix this glaring oversight and also please treat users with more respect. That is the only way Nokia might have a chance to earn back the respect it burned. Hope they are listening...

title: I miss the old app
text: I wish they didn’t change the way the app was before Withings was acquired by Nokia. When Nokia first took over, they absolutely ruined the app. It’s a bit better now, but not as good as it was when it was just Withings. I only updated because I couldn’t delete unknown measurements with the old app anymore, must be a bug with the outdated version. There are a couple things I like about the new app, the trends section is nice, but in particular the graphs in the old app were way better. I have data from my scale going back to 2016, I could zoom in on any particular segment without being locked in to the month, and it showed a true 14 day average rather than some projected trend line or whatever the new app shows. The scrolling banner on the timeline screen was also a nice touch. Oh well, such is big corporate business, I guess. So-called improvements are often harmful.

title: App is horrible
text: This app does not work well.  The dashboard and settings are not user friendly and don’t display the data in a useful way.  I’ve signed up for two of the programs and neither function properly.  One tells me to manually log my exercise, which I did, then gives me zero credit for it and gives me an F for the week.  The other, the pregnancy program, is off by a week despite having my correct due date.  While I would love to be 10 weeks pregnant, I’m only 9!  And even after reading the article it recommends, that is the only article that ever shows up as an option to read from the main pregnancy screen.  The app is overall NOT user friendly that all I’m really able to do is use the scale as a regular scale which sort of defeats the purpose of having a smart scale provide you with data that you could analyze over time.  Fitbit was Garmin have much better apps for similar data types.

title: App is fine, but scale itself has issues. Support difficult to contact.
text:
After initial setup of the Withings body+, everything was great. The scale and app worked for about two months. Then, all of a sudden, the scale stopped connecting to my WiFi. Once that happens, no data is saved into the app, even though there is a Bluetooth connection. I tried everything I could think of, and nothing worked. All other devices connected fine to the network. I tried to contact Withings support, but had issues, which have still not been resolved to allow logging in. So, I am left with only this forum to complain about the physical hardware.
In a desperate attempt to get it working again, I tried changing to new batteries. Lo and behold, this fixed my network issues. Now, after just another two weeks, my scale once again will not connect to WiFi. Changing batteries offers no relief this time. This is unacceptable. For the cost of this scale, there should not be this many issues.

title: Helpful but connected GPS is unreliable
text:
It’s a very good app with lots of info that I regularly use. 

I also have the Steel HR watch. The communication between the app and watch is not very dependable. I don’t know who’s fault it is, Apple’s iOS, the watch, iPhone or app, but it’s been a few years already and it’s just not good. 

To begin with, the watch is supposed to sync with the app in the background but most of the time it only syncs when I open the app. Then I have to wait.

A more annoying feature is Connected GPS. It’s accurate enough to not require on device GPS, but the connection between the app and watch is unreliable. At the start of a run or bike ride I have to first launch the app, but then I have to put the phone away in my backpack or pouch, and by then the watch often can’t connect anymore. Sometimes the connection drops in the middle of the activity so half the data isn’t recorded. There is never a reason given or a warning, just nothing recorded. 

Support can’t really help here. 

Overall though, it’s still very informative, and the sleep tracking and analysis is very good and valuable. It’s being developed and polished regularly. It’s still something I need and want to use, and don’t see competition, but it could be better.

title: Normally great, with recent bugs
text:
I’ve used this app for five years now, and most of the time it’s been great. This last sept. 2021 update, however, has introduced some bugs that make it a bunch less useful. 
- weight measurements, at least for me, always opens up on the “all” view rather than whatever range you last had. Not only is this not useful (seeing my five year weight trend is not what I want to check most days), but it often means the current day’s weigh-on won’t show even when I shift to “month” view, since the points have been snipped for the larger graph. 
- vascular age always shows in “quarter” mode rather than anything more detailed. All the data points are there but super squished!
- VO2 Max display appears to be colored blue everywhere, rather that differently colored for different sections. 
Overall still a good app, but a number of annoyances recently.

title: Awesome Product
text: I was so very happy and excited to discover that a Bluetooth blood pressure cuff was made!! The design makes keeping up with your blood pressure, heart rate, etc so very convenient!! Plus where it keeps a running total on your smartphone, tablet, etc it makes it so very easy to show your doctors exactly what your blood pressure averages?!? I highly recommend this for anyone needing to check their blood pressure daily!! There is also a thermometer that they make that’s also very cool and convenient....I have it also!! I highly recommend that everyone that has to keep a running tally of their health records invest into both!! After all, they use the same interface on your smartphone and can easily share them with your doctor.  A+++++++++

title: Watch very disappointing
text: I have a steel HR watch. I am very disappointing with the notifications. The email notification has never worked. I contacted the customer service several times and they sent me a copy paste of the instructions. I am not stupid enough not to be able to follow instructions. Then they admitted that there is a bug somewhere and they will provide an update to correct it. 6 months later I am still waiting. In addition, other notifications (texts, call,...) don’t work all the time. For whatever reason the notifications stop working each 2 to 3 weeks. I have the app open on the phone, notifications are enable, but nothing. Sometimes turning off the Bluetooth for few minutes and then turning it back on is enough to solve the issue. Other times I have to do a factory reset. Here again no help of the customer service, they have just sent me the instructions again... So if you think about buying this product, don’t!

title: Crashing and not syncing
text: I have had my watch and app for several years and they worked great together with free issues. They used to account for naps, but that went away. Please bring that back. But now for the past several months my app keeps crashing. It doesn’t sync to my apple health app frequently like it is supposed to. And now they both crash. My Withings app won’t sync with my tracker thoroughly anymore. It shows the data, but doesn’t actually sync when I check the last sync it says 2 days ago. The loading action appears and just blinks ongoing when I open the app. Sometimes I open the withings app and it just crashes instantly (black screen) even a force quit to close the app doesn’t fix the problem. I even shut my iphone off and then after a restart the tracker watch won’t sync to the app. Very frustrating.

title: Amazing watch
text:
This watch has RIDICULOUS battery life. Mine lasted almost 2 weeks with full use and it was only down to 43%. I charged it up and after a week it's still almost at 100%. I used it this week on a cruise and when my phone changed time, I would open the app and watch it sync, and the watch hands would jump to the new correct time. Great functionality. 

Developers: if you guys could add a feature to skip music tracks or change volume, this would hands down be the best watch ever in the entire universe. The music/volume control was a deal breaker feature for me, BUT since it has stupid long battery life I bought it anyways. If you could add this feature in the future I would absolutely adore this watch 10x more than I already do. 

Thank you :)

title: Inconsistent sleep scores between phone and desktop
text: The mat seems pretty sensitive, although it sometimes has difficulty distinguishing between reading quietly in bed and light sleep. It seems good at telling whether or not I’m awake during the night. In general I’m quite pleased with it and  finding it useful. However, the sleep scores on the Healthmate app on my phone and the one on my desktop have been quite different. I’ve used it for 8 nights. During this time the scores were the same between phone and computer only twice. Twice the scores varied by 1 point. The other 4 times the scores varied by 8-10 points. The awake time , disturbance numbers, total sleep time and time in various sleep stages seems to be the same on both, so why the difference and which one is “correct?”

title: Why the Thermo App ?
text:
Hello, Withings. I use this app on a daily basis. Of course, like anything else, it can always be improved. But there are 2 things which bother me:
1) Why do you have the thermo app ? Why isn’t it all integrated within the Health Mate app, as it is with the scale or the BPM Core ?
2) Concerning the BPM Core, could you make it possible for the user to manually select the blood pressure classification, rather than having the app automatically selecting it based on the phone settings ?
There are some other features I’d like to see added, so that I rely less on external apps. For example how about tracking the physical activity (other than the steps), such as running and biking ? Or tracking the food eaten together with a scanner and different food scores ?
Thanks anyhow for the good work so far.

title: Great Scale, Not So Great App
text: I’ve used the Withings Body+ scale and enjoy the feedback it’s been giving me. The app shows my trends which has been very helpful. However, when I weigh and it doesn’t include BMI, I try to delete that measurement, but the app deletes a different measurement I want to keep. Almost like it’s a day off so it’s deleting data I’m using in trends and not the data that I’m requesting. Additionally, every time I switch to view my history on a monthly level, it takes me alllll the way back to my first measurement (imported from another app) in January 2021 rather than the current month with the most recent weigh-ins. It’s frustrating having to scroll back each time to look at current data and that I’m losing data I want to keep because it’s not deleting the correct record. Would recommend the scale, but the app needs some updates.

title: Same connectivity issues
text:
Update: I see that connectivity problem with Aura is fixed. Please, keep it up, and make the app really informative and engaging.

I’m wondering if the app is being tested before rollout. It is taking me up to 5 min to connect to my Aura to set an alarm, which is way to much to spend when you want to sleep. The recent app update made it even worse, it doesn’t fix connectivity issue, and all my settings went to trash. How is it possible? Are you going to fix it really fast or it’s planned to have another update in half a year?
Ps: I own a variety of Withings products, and was considering a few more, but what I can see from reviews in AppStore, Nokia Home has same connectivity problems and bad reviews for the apps, not the hardware itself. And that puts me on pause, while issues are not resolved.

title: Nokia keeps to self-distruct
text: What a wonderful application it was before Nokia took it to their hands. It was very warm and welcoming application. I purchased both scale and cuff to work on my weight loosing adventure. The old application was my daily companion with colorful screens and nice set up I felt welcomed every day when I used it. It wasn't perfect but it was personal. What Nokia did was to take soul away, got bunch of people redesigning the application (they probably had really limited idea what it meant to us) and delivered bold, soulless product with nothing to look into it. They ruined their cell phone business and are all the way not do better with this product. You at Nokia should think why so many negative reviews? Are most of us wrong? Most of the companies cherish base of their long and devoted customers. What you guys do, is exactly opposite. I am not going to beg to bring the old application back because it is pointless. Just as a company think how you are holding your business especially if you are planning new acquisitions.

title: Pretty Decent but lacking some interfaces
text:
Just bought the Withings + and was to replace a Renpho scale. 

First concern is the drastic difference in reported body fat. The Renpho reports 13.6% body fat and the Withings reports 23.7% which is a big difference. I know the Renpho is an entry level scale at 1/4 of the price, but still makes me wonder which is more accurate. I would consider myself to fall somewhere in between the two. 

Two things lacking which it doesn’t import is Nutrition and Sleep. 

I have an iPhone and Apple Watch. I use MyPlate from LiveStrong to track nutrition and AutoSleep from Tantissa which both write data to Apple’s Health app. And I do see that information in the Health app. 

I would like to see that data imported in a future update! Specially Sleep which already shows up on the web but in my case shows No Recent Data. 

I’m sure that most of the IOS users would love to see this added!

But overall not happy with the purchase. Developers give same excuse to contact support for any critical reviews but do not address concerns. And the link they give doesn’t work!

I returned it and will go back to my much cheaper and more accurate and informative Renpho!!

title: Privacy Failure
text:
Based on the privacy policy linked to from the App Store, If I were to actually use this app, Withings can 1: Store my personal health information wherever they want. 2: Share it with “authorized third parties”, i.e., whomever *they* “authorize”. 3: Change the policy without any notice. 4: Use my personal health information for anything they want, including targeting advertising.

All I want to do is use my phone to help me check my blood pressure regularly and share that information with third parties *I* authorize. My phone is more than capable of storing millions of readings and already allows me to control sharing data in numerous ways. Why do I have to create yet another account that could be compromised and use that account store my data remotely, unencrypted, and under the control of Withings and whomever *they* authorize)?

I‘m willing to pay $100 for a well designed, functional blood pressure monitor that will simply monitor my blood pressure. This software is the sole reason I will not be purchasing Withings hardware.

title: Horrible update
text:
Update:  Changing to 3 stars. I had given up on app since I could not easily share readings with my Dr.  See now the feature was added back in. Do not understand why it was removed in the first place but thank you for bringing it back.  Still think the UX has lots of room for improvement.  Pretty, but confusing to use. 

Update:  Still cannot share my blood pressure readings with my doctor! Really wish I hadn't updated.  This is the poster child case for not doing automatic app updates.

Update: the latest update did not add back the ability to share historical readings with my doctor.  Now my dashboard is blank as well as my BP graph, even after logging in again as the app instructed.  What was a very useful app still ruined.

This update takes huge steps backwards.  UI is fancier but nowhere as streamlined and easy to use as the prior version.  They have taken out the feature to share with my doctor, or buried it somewhere I cannot find.  The only option I see is to share a single measurement, which is useless to me.  This is not a social app.  I need to share a history so my doctor can see trends and I don't have to waste time sending every time I take a measurement.

I paid a lot of money for this BP cuff and this update has removed a ton of value from it.  Very disappointing.

title: Will Not measure body fat, etc
text:
I have had this scale for about 2 years and I just started KETO so I am more interested in all the additional measurements it takes when I stand on the scale without socks. I have reset it several times to try to get it to work, nothing, replaced batteries, still nothing just would do my weight. I did notice two days ago it started calculating BMI which it hadn’t done since I first got it. I paid full price $199 and am really disappointed that it doesn’t do all that it said it would do.  Maybe the other measures will come back too if I just keep using it everyday. 
**** Also I think it is terrible that your scale will not take measurements from my Apple app. It will not FORCE me to buy one of your watches it just makes me mad 😡 when I am in the app and look to see what else you are offering. ****

title: Nice quality app for health reporting
text:
I use this for blood pressure measurements and that part works fine. I am replacing a Quardio which is pretty good and easy to use, but the hardware kept dying on me. The Withings hardware is slightly harder to setup and use because every is done with the unit. There are some advantages to that. You don’t need your phone to take a measurement. But the Qardio too full advantage of having the app setup and measurements. Overall I think the Withings approach is better for long term users.
The real star is the Withings app for health reporting. It pulls in data from Apple Health and generates a easy to read report for you and your doctor. This app is top of the line in user interface and reporting.

title: Disappointing
text: I have had issues with the data tracking for a long time and eventually gave up and primarily used my scale as one would use an analog scale. Recently, I decided to try syncing my scale again and using the app for the first time since the Nokia acquisition. To my disappointment, not only is the syncing issue not resolved (proven by two hours of going through every troubleshooting, resetting, battery changing process imaginable), the app itself which was once cumbersome but workable is now totally unusable. It looks like a lot of data is missing, and I cannot navigate back from the chart to the main menu. I’m using an iPad Pro, and the frame is cropped to about 20% of the screen. To my dismay, my investigation into this matter has shown others have experienced what I’ve experienced without resolution and resulted in dead ends with customer service. It is because of this that I am not even bothering with contacting Nokia, and I am investigating other options at this time.

title: let us churn out our own raw data for our own stats and graphs creations
text:
give us control over all our data stats graphics, we want to decide what stats to look at and in our own combinations

spreadsheets of our data and self selection of the data points relevant to us, to create our own graphs

I’ve takin stats classes, I want control over churning all my uploaded raw data in ways that are relevant to me.

Contrived App data trend numbers and line graphs are way to basic.

I want my raw data to manipulate for my own uses and decide what graphs I want to utilize to plot the data myself.  Not App generated basic manipulation and output.

The auto-type of responses are equally frustrating on here.

We need direct first hand Use Case Analysts acknowledging that they clearly understand the issues we’re bringing forward here (in our own personal time!).

The least Nokia could do is put highly skilled and knowledgeable, real, live, point staff here, to write legitimate in-person, directly relatable answers to address the stated concerns.  Do not make broad sweeping form letter response...”take more of your personal time and go take your issue up at some other level of administration”.

That’s the job of paid staff!  To take the feedback given here to the next level, research to get answers, respond knowledgeably back to our responses here and solve the one star ratings.   

Use Case Analyst, QA!  Hire, hire, hire.

title: Pregnancy program not currently working
text: A lot of the metrics shown in the app are pretty cool, but I bought this particular smart scale because of the pregnancy program and insights it gives pregnant women about the metrics and their body composition/weight gain during this time. Unfortunately, since the day I got the scale, the app has a bug that won’t allow me to join the pregnancy program and just gets the user stuck in a loop. Other users are having the same issue in the forum. Support responds, but the general response is that they’re aware of the bug and it should be corrected in the next update (with no ETA). I’m curious if it’s broken for all users or just some of us. Anyway, it’s disappointing because obviously all of these body composition metrics should be taken with a grain of salt while you’re pregnant, but I don’t know how to think about any of them (which is why I got the scale).

title: This new version made the old one that I gave one star look great.
text:
The worst is the app or the scale doesn't immediately update the app with new readings, and there is no way to trigger them to do so. So right now it is showing yesterday's reading when I've weighed in twice since then. The missing readings eventually show up but unpredictably. There's no rhyme or reason why they do or don't.

They asked me to update this: So the app sometimes updates pretty quickly with new readings, but then again sometimes it doesn’t. Interestingly other apps, such as Lose It, update almost immediately with a new scale reading, so the problem is their app, not the scale or WiFi or the cloud. They should be pretty embarrassed other app vendors can use the data from their scale before their own app does. 

I don't know why they changed the graphs and interface because it was not an improvement and they are clunky to use. They don’t scroll or scale nicely and have way too much white space.

title: Bad for your health
text: It was once a platform of accurate and reliable health data, but it lost its structure. Importing sleep data from your Apple Watch is a terrible idea because it’s crap data. I love my Apple Watch but you will never get reliable sleep data from it. The Sleep Mat however is accurate, so that should be the only product able to write sleep data in the app. This is just one of many inaccuracies. Also, you can’t opt out of the awful coaching dialogues, even if you tell it to go away permanently. When they first launched that feature, it actually provided quality feedback. It’s the least motivating app ever. I find more entertainment populating fake walks because you can now. What a joke. I had so much promise in this company. I have so many of their products. They’re useless now. I’m going to ask that Apple remove this from the App Store. They just do not care, and are doing more harm than good.

title: Terrible, it could be so much better.
text: Wish this was better. Scale may mysteriously stop working. It’s obvious this company doesn’t care about their product, app, or support experience. They don’t respond to support tickets (clear from the many support forums). Their help docs are terrible. Resetting a device when you finally figure it out is inconsistent. The only solution that actually worked was to “find another device” and re-install and re-pair it.... because everyone has a spare iPhone laying around. Are you kidding me. A premium product +$100 should be better than this. If the general support experience is bad, the app is worse. Obvious they haven’t updated it to support new iPhones, the setup process is inconsistent, tells you all sorts of errors that are not helpful... only to direct you to their equally terrible support docs. Update your app. Update your support guides. Respond to your customers. It’s really that basic.

title: Needs multi frequency segmental handheld hardware
text: App is beautiful and helpful and such a long way from the disaster after initially acquiring Withlings. The problem is the fat percents while consistent are consistently much lower than the actual amounts determined from dexa scans. The problem is it’s just a scale so only measures bottom half of body and completely guesses top half. Better scales solve this by also including an attach hand held attachment. And the best scales so that but also are multi frequency so that they can most accurately detect each segment of the body. The downside is those scales have relatively horrible apps. Nokia hasnt launched a new hardware in a while so would seem that would be the next step for the most accurate scale and with the power of their amazing app. In the meantime as much as I love this app and hardware accuracy is most important so switching to the Tanita multi frequency scale.

title: Very disappointing
text:
Got the scale some time ago.  It used to give a weekly average weight, which was very helpful.   Now that’s gone, and instead it sends me a text three minutes after I get on the scale to tell me stupid things, like “congratulations!   You only gained 1.5 pounds from yesterday.”   Who thought this up?   And the text messages wake up my sleeping wife.  STOP!!!   Don’t do this!   Hello?   Anybody there?   Hello???

The watch app doesn’t recognize when I start exercising on a stationary bike.  Or when I start.   And it’s hard to remember and then get to the manual startup.  And even harder to remember to stop it.  

I no longer use the app for anything except the occasional reminder of last week’s weight numbers.

title: Inaccurate data
text: I’ve been using this app for a few years, since I bought my first Nokia scale. The interface is easy and self explanatory, it offers you insights and trends on the various data it collects from your devices and other third party, through the iOS Health app. However, the data it retrieves from Health is always wrong and I can’t find a way to correct it. It usually shows shorter lengths in running or walking activities, and wrong calorie count. I don’t rely on this app except for the weight measurements and those are usually accurate, however, for some weird reason the last measurement is never shown on the trend chart. This app is “mandatory” to retrieve data from my scales, and so I use it for its main purpose.

title: Be careful in buying this product!
text:
I bought a iBP device three years ago, it worked well until last May when they updated the app. The new app requires that you allow cookies, allow withings to have your health data, and are required to allow them to send you promotional emails. This might not be an issue if you don’t care where your health data goes, but is certainly an issue if you require privacy. I contacted both Apple and withings. Apple said it was not their problem and withings refused to do anything about it. They implied that I was the issue not their product.
I stopped using it but due to health problems have had to restart daily monitoring. I downloaded the new software but I can’t get it to work with the older cuff. I wish they had just left it alone because it worked fine to begin with. I would never recommend this product to anyone else.

title: Please, give us the old app back!
text:
Edit 2 - November 2: The developer response to my review was that they appreciate the feedback, and that they would bring functionality back (which also acknowledges they took it from us). So... how exactly did you sue the feedback? The app is still less functional, less informative and less intuitive than it was before? Why on earth did you make all this mess in the first place? You ripped us all off! Shame on you, Nokia.
