Shame on you Nokia! You destroyed one of the few apps I actually used over the years. Shame shame shame on the destruction of shareholder value.

title: Support is really disappointing
text: Please find a fix to the dashboard to display the same weight and the journal weight. My dashboard is days old and my journal weight is up to date. Had a very horrible experience with 2 reps calls and finally the 3rd saw exactly what I was referencing. This is on app and web dashboard. It should take this long I was made to believe I am the only one having issues it’s not just the app but the web also with all of these complaints on different platforms I hope the information is being reviewed as I will be forced to go to a competitor. The metrics is what I need and the main reason for purchase

title: This doesn’t sync in real time/ bad system for assigning weight
text: This doesn’t sync in real time. I have another Bluetooth scale (YUNMAI) which is way better. As soon as you get on that scale it tells you your weight in real time. As you stand on this scale, you’re unsure if it is recording your weight. When you look at your phone nothing is happening. For such an expensive scale you should have a better app, that syncs the weight in real time. As you step on the scale your weight should show on your app. This system for assigning weight is terrible. I have a big family and when they go on the weights get confusing. You have to lean on one side instead of the app asking you “are you so and so?” This is not worth the price and needs to fix the app.

title: Weight personal trainer program does not work
text: I generally do not write reviews but I am doing so now hoping that this issue will be fixed. Each time I try to access the weight program for week 1 and go through the Intro and scroll up to view the description of fat % and muscle %, the app immediately stops loading right after fat% with the error message “ uh oh better body is unavailable now. Stay strong and it’ll be right back. We promise”. I was really hoping to use the program but it’s not been fixed even after updates.

title: Can’t connect to network
text:
I recently dumped Optimum as my Internet provider (they’re HORRIBLE) and now have a new account with T-Mobile (I’ve had my cell phone with them for years). While everything else is now working better, my Nokia scale, which, until now, has been great refuses to connect to my network! UGH!! I’ve tried and tried to re-pair the scale but nothing works. My scale is now nothing more that a brick. :(

Update: something is wrong - my scale suddenly paired but can’t seem to figure out what happened.

title: Best visualization of weight development.
text: I youse the Withings scale on daly biases as kind of a Biofeedback.  I use it in combination with My Fitness Pal to count calories. My best advice is don’t try do losses wight to fast. Not to gaine is alrady a success. All the extra ponds you gained of years so for me each month with out a gaine is a success. And I try not to lose more than a pound per month. So you are in for the long hall. So don’t think about Bikini body in spring and than gaine it all back by Christmas. It’s more like I will have a healthy weight for the rest off my live.

title: Love the app and gadgets!
text:
UPDATE: Removing one star because it only reads that from Apple Health App and doesn't share your weight, body fat % or activity :(

I found out about Withings after my partner purchased a Withings scale. I downloaded the app and I started using the scale. App runs without any issues and the design is great, it synchronizes with the scale super fast and with issueas. I also found out through the app that they also make watches and I ended up purchasing a Withings HR Steel sport watch for me and a Withings Move for my mom. We absolutely love them! Apps works great with those too

title: Some Localization Issues
text:
Love the watch and the app. But I think there might be some localization issues with the app. 
My language setting is Chinese. I find the title of the alarm page is “警报” instead of “闹钟”.  I believe “警报” in Chinese means “Warning” or “Alert”, which is not proper here. Also, I find the calories was translated to “卡里路” instead of “卡路里”.  And I think there are some more issues regarding to the translation. I think those incorrect translations would cause misunderstanding to Chinese users.
The app would be great if you could double check on those localization things.

title: Very little development of app
text:
I am continually disappointed in this app. I’ve used it for years and it has gone backwards in terms of accuracy and functionality. Most recently, with our sleep pads, it shows you being asleep when you are not, and there is no way to edit specific time segments, you can only edit your start and end sleep times, which is pretty darn pointless if you’re the least bit knowledgeable about the sleep patterns of 99.5% of all human beings on this planet...nobody sleeps consistently from the moment they go to bed until they awake. 

You also cannot have devices in more than one household, which is a pain to re-pair a device every time you go to a weekend home. A bit silly that they can’t fix this!

title: The App Is Now Terrible
text: I use the app with my Withings WiFi scales. The app used to remember your last view setting (ie, month, quarter, year, all) and when you clicked on “Weight” it would show your most recent measurements. A week or so ago, it stopped doing that. Now it zooms out to all and it takes multiple clicks and zoo s to actually get to your current, relevant data. I have several years worth of weigh-ins. Makes the app a total pain to use - to the point I’m about to buy scales from another brand.

title: Don't update
text:
This terrible update takes control of many features away from the user and turns on battery wasting features I don't want.  Description of update deceptive.  Deleting app and returning scale.  Why couldn't they leave it alone. 

Great, their new update puts ads for their other lousy stuff in the middle of the weights it records.  Their "personal response" to my review was insulting.  It's not my battery, and treating me like a moron was not helpful.  Go back to the Withings software.  You don't have enough cousins to write fake reviews to offset all of the actual users who hate your app.  I was going to return  the scale but my cat likes the shiny glass.  As soon as I find a floor mirror for my cat it's as good as gone.

P.S.  If you call my review "precious" again I'll tell you what I really think about you.

title: Health Mate
text: Health Mate just keeps getting better.  I am using the latest beta version and it is really slick.  I like the info that it tracks and how it is displayed.  Also like the supplemental information that is provided.  I think that perhaps the algorithm used to measure steps could use some work.  When I use the Nokia step counter it is usually way less than the three pedometers I run it against.  The disparity is substantial.  Normally by the end of the day, the health mate app indicates about 16,000 steps versus 20,000 + for my other pedometers.  Big difference.  Too big!!! That needs

title: App is good, wish for better resting HR and better sleep tracking
text:
App works ok, kinda annoying you can’t sync food from Cronometer (or anything but runkeeper).
What I really wish they had was correct resting HR, as cardio health is my main goal. They only sample your heart-rate every ten minutes to save battery but who needs more than a week of it? Especially when incorrect data is the tradeoff.
The other thing is the scanwatch can’t really detect sleep correctly- no naps added as sleep, sleep only during night hours… If they had proper heart-rate data, they would be able to fix this and simply detect when you’re asleep.

title: Better!
text:
Update:  the app is working now and we are enjoying the information it provides. It takes a bit to register on the app from the scale, but it does update. It is not easy to see the progress on the app though as the display only shows the current info. I can see the progress on the computer. 
The scale is great and I love the sleek design. However, with the app, when it records my husband’s weight, it shows up on my timeline and vice versa. This is frustrating as we can’t compare our individual progress. Can you work on this please? I would love to be able to give this more stars.

title: A great app with equally good devices
text:
App works really well. Products are all plug and play. I own all of the devices other than the smart watch. Good quality and reliable. I would buy a watch but simply cannot give up my  watch. 

App plays well with others, such as  Health and Lifesum. Had a technical glitch a year ago related to an iOS version update and the tech guys answered everything promptly. New iOS 14 widget is basic but I find  it useful. Overall, highly recommended app and device range.

title: Incredible watch, atrocious customer service
text:
Amazing watch! I’ve had such a great experience with my Steel HR watch until the latest update.

I was told that a software update that completely bricked the watch "wasn't covered under warranty" and I'd have to buy a new one at 75% price. That's like iOS 13 breaking an iPhone and Apple telling me to buy a new one to fix it. Completely ridiculous. I went back and forth with the support people 3 times to no avail, after I’d tested a bunch of things and taken videos for them.

I get that because of Covid, no repair places are open/reduced service/etc. but that shouldn't affect the consumer experience in such drastic ways. I'm disappointed and sad that such amazing technology is backed up by such terrible service.

Finally after asking to speak to a supervisor, I was able to get them to service it and send me a new watch, after 3 weeks of persistence. I do appreciate that! But realistically, most people won't be so confrontational and persistent. Shame on Withings for making it come to that.

Won’t be buying another watch from them despite how awesome their tech is.

title: Good products, but value stops short
text:
I love my scale, but it doesn’t sync with my Apple Health App - that would be convenient to see all my data in one place on the health app. What’s up??!
My blood pressure cuff also suddenly quit communicating with my app. Not sure if this is an update problem? But nonetheless disappointed because of the cost of the now worthless device. 

I am hoping and waiting for this brand to  eventually fully communicate data with the Apple health App.  I own Apple products for their simplicity and reliability; I need devices that do the same, and populate all health data to one place. 
Com’on  WITHINGS... work “WITH” my Apple App!!!

title: Dear Nokia
text:
I got to say that when Withings first switched to Nokia I was pretty disappointed. I didn’t like the new layouts, changed features and color scheme BUT as more updates have come along Nokia has been winning me over.

The graph looks a lot more accurate, bugs have been fixed, syncing is not a problem anymore and it’s very easy to move through the graph and timeline. I also really like the encouragement messages that appear in the timeline every now and then and the recently released wellness programs you can enroll in seem very motivating. 

I do wish some features Withings used to have remained. I miss having the option to set a weekly goal and see my progress throughout the week. I also wish I could set a body fat goal like you can do with a weight goal. The whole point of using a scale like this is to emphasize how body fat is more important than weight when looking at getting fitter so why not be able to set a goal for it? 

Keep up the good work and I believe you’ll completely win me over. Thank you, Nokia.

title: Kinda, almost works with Apple Health
text: I purchased a steel HR after returning my Fitbit for the sole purpose of wanting it to work with Apple health. I looked at the box before I bought it and I noticed it has two things I advertise, “Day and Overnight Heart Rate” and “Works with Apple health”. After using it for day I couldn’t figure out how to get the data to actually sink into a Apple Health. So I reached out to their support staff and got a pointless copy paste response saying that the heart rate data does not sync with Apple Health. It does for the scale, it does for the blood pressure monitor, but it doesn’t for the one device that actually has Heart Rate in the name. I would go so far as say this is flagrant false advertising.

title: Buggy and boring
text:
As many others have mentioned, the interface is so boring compared to the Withings version. I have tried going to my weight measurements table and clicked on one of the weights to see the details. It never takes you to the weight you clicked on. It is always one weight off. You would think that Nokia would have beta tested this before pushing it out.

Update: November 7, 2017 - my scales and watch worked fine until Nokia took over. Now it is next to impossible to sync either device. The app can never find my watch or data stored on my watch. I replaced the batteries in my scales and it took hours to get it to sync with the app. What a shame! Maybe it’s time to switch to Fitbit.

title: Best update
text:
I have very critical of this app, having to have it for my wife’s insurance plan. Without it, data from my Apple Watch does not sync with the website that they use.

When I first started using it, the step count was off by 500+, and if I did not login into the app, it would not add my data for that day.

After the most recent update, step count is within 5, either over or under, of what is in my Apple Watch, and I can open the app the next day and it adds my data.

title: New version has too much problems
text:
I updated to the newest version of this app, now I can’t get any of my notifications on my watch! Also, I am consistently around 1,000 steps short on activities; I know this because I often go walking with my husband and he has a longer stride than me yet I have 1,000 less steps recorded. Makes it hard to be excited about setting step goals. Also after activities I have had the app reset my step count dropping from over 5,000 to under 3,000 steps!! 

So far the only reason I like this more than my last activity tracking watch is the heart rate, but I’m seriously considering returning the watch and looking for a different option with these issues!!

title: Worst. App. Ever.
text:
I miss the Withings app. I purchased the Withings scale and loved how easy it was to track my weight loss. That’s all I want to do!!  There is so much CRAP on this app that doesn’t  need to be there!  You can’t just pick the apps you want to use - the Healthmate app pushes every other tracker on you. 

Just make it so that it will pair with my scale and track my weight. If I decide I would like the other unnecessary features, then let me add them from another tab or something.

Honestly, I’m about to say to heck with the whole thing and just buy a new smart scale.

title: Nice idea, dreadful implementation
text:
I like the idea of apps being integrated, but this is not. I set up the app to log me on using a fingerprint, but I always have to log in twice; not the end of the world, but why? I give it a fingerprint & it immediately cycles back to the login panel and asks again.

I tried the integration with myfitnesspal, again, a nice idea but it doesn't seem to work very well. It never picks up the calories from MFP, although it does sometimes send step data. 

When they get this app working properly it will answer a lot of my requirements but they are not close at this point in time.

title: Haven’t had trouble
text:
Bought a new scale at Christmas 2017. The scale and the app have synced well and I can interface with HealthKit and MyFitnessPal. 

I was concerned because of the problems others have had but I don’t know if because I got a new scale the interface works better or I’ve just been fortunate. 

I have really liked how everything automatically syncs with my phone and other applications without any trouble. The charts to track weight are very helpful and the ability to get estimated fat percentage, muscle mass and bone mass is very helpful too.

title: Over 10 years, and still going!
text:
I was in a health professions program when I bought my scale and loved it. 10 years and many pounds later, I still find it to be a fabulous motivator for healthy eating and exercise. (It also tells me when not to over feed the cat, too, as she *loves* to sit on it when I wash my hands.) 

Although I am a big believer in manual manometry, it is impossible to do on oneself, so I also purchased the original blood pressure cuff. While I wasn’t a huge fan of some of the app updates under that other company, I’m thrilled that it’s back under Withthings.

I even got a cuff and scale for my parents, which gives me tremendous peace of mind.

I look forward to where the company’s development goes in the future, as I believe they are solid. I hope that now they’re back under their own umbrella, the app will smooth out as well.

title: So far been pleased but...
text: So far I’ve been really pleased with this scale and app. There are a few things that bug me, like on the Home Screen when you loose or go up on the scale the arrows are the opposite. Example..fat loss lowers but the arrow will say it went up! Also wish it would sync with Apple health for tracking sleep. Wish the app layout was better also. I also wish it tracked more things like visceral fat, so many scales have that feature for far less money. I think I’m going to try a different scale and compare it to this one.

title: Overjoyed!
text: It all started with their scale. Great product. Then I decided to purchase their watch (the basic one).  I had this watch for approximately 5-6 years with only replacing the battery once. Then I purchased the blood pressure monitor which I’m very pleased with. About six months ago I upgraded my watch to the latest and passed on the original one to a friend which she is still using. All in all I couldn’t be more happy with this product!  These people know their stuff.   I’m a happy camper :)

title: Must use
text: I have been using the Withings App and products for many years. Over the years there have been a few glitches, but today both the products (all) and app seem extremely stable. I have taken each device to my doctor’s office to ensure accuracy of the readings. In every case the readings were identical to the doctor’s devices. In these days of uncertainty it is important to have reliable devices. For me, the BPM has been a life saver and has alerted me twice of issues.

title: Outstanding product!
text: I am impressed by both the quality of the hardware and the software.  I like how they work to keep new innovations and improvements coming on both sides.  I’ve used their products for over two years now and everything works without any problems. Only comment I have would be the device requires battery changes about every other month.  It’s a small price to pay for b the benefits received.  Excellent product, you’ll love it!

title: Healthmate blood pressure monitor doesn’t work on iPhone 11
text: have an iPhone 11 ProMax and I use my blood pressure monitor with the Withings app. However, this model of phone will not sync to the PB device. Whenever you try to add a device via Bluetooth nothing happens. I’ve called technical support and the answer is “wait for the software update.” I’ve waited a month and called back recently only to be told “we’re still working on it.” This is unacceptable since this particular Apple model has been on the market for months now. Please develop something soon. I used to use this product daily to help monitor my overall blood pressure health and progress. Now I’m looking for alternative manufacturers. Sorry Withings... please get it together

title: Poor support and poor connection
text:
I have had this scale for about 2 months. One day it just stopped syncing with my phone. I tried all the troubleshooting listed on the website and when nothing worked I contacted support. I have been going back and forth with them for almost 2
weeks and nothing they have suggested has helped. They also don’t seem to understand my problem and responded with “looks like you’re all setup via Bluetooth, here’s how to get wifi set up” with a link to the support website. Actually, my Bluetooth is still not connecting and my scale is not syncing with the app. I have tried different devices, reinstalling the app, new batteries, old batteries, etc. Extremely disappointed:

title: “Improvements” are continuous dis-improvement
text:
App keeps updating to add features but fails at what it originally did well - just downloading your data. For instance step counts are now almost always are off +/- 10%. Forget advanced features if they’re are at the cost of basic functions.
Update: above issues have greatly improved - thanks!
But now I see a new “feature” which is for each day I see several “New Activity”s, apparently when I walk enough steps in some interval to trigger the entry. However, if I save one it saves only that particular activity - additional similar activities are still considered “new.”
This pretty much triples the screen space each day takes up.
I can see no way to turn off this feature, much as I’ve tried.
So another cutsie feature that seems to serve no purpose and can’t be turned off.
Update: So now it wants to use Bluetooth to communicate with all my devices or it won’t communicate with my tracker. Uh, no thanks. Really don’t like an app forcing me to allow it access to other devices. Give me a choice or go home.

title: So disappointed
text:
It’s not recording my mother’s weight and No single unassigned figures either. So where has all the recorded weight gone for my mother? Only found out today and we did another measurement. It shows on my phone but doesn’t sync with my mothers phone. So frustrating. Had to do it manually. Do I have to monitor her when she goes on the scale to make sure the app records her weight? 
Unassigned weights should always be stored on my phone so I can assign it.
Sometimes when I go on it, I have to jump off fast enough so it doesn’t store it under my mum. We clearly don’t even weigh close enough. She’s in the 64’s and I’m in the 68’s 
Reads the temperatures of the day and that’s all it does right. Not that it’s relevant when you are monitoring your weight and not the temperature of the day.

title: Opaque and an unacceptable invasion of privacy
text:
I like the scale, but not this app. First, the app requires a login and sends your health info to some unknown place on the web. This is a huge invasion of privacy, borderline illegal. There is no valid reason for Withings to collect this information. It’s invasive, and unacceptable.

The app replaces a detailed instruction manual. But there’s no actual help in it when things don’t work perfectly. My scale is not working in an obvious way and the app is utterly useless and trying to figure out what’s wrong.

There’s also way too much information in the app itself, organized in a haphazard way—It unnecessarily collects info from other health apps but does not organize the info intelligently or compactly. I assume that it also invades your privacy by sending this additional information into the internet somewhere.

Frankly, I’d be happier with something that focused on the scale and nothing else.

Finally, I now have four apps, all called Health<Something>, with similar icons. It’s almost impossible to remember which is which. A less generic name and icon wouldn’t hurt.

title: Terrible, does not work as advertised. Very Frustrating.
text:
Spent over an hour trying to get the app to recognize a Withings Body + scale (supposedly made by the same company). It kept timing out, nothing would work. 

Ultimately, the scale seems to work when I step on it. But have not gotten it to work with the app or the phone. Which was the point from the beginning. 

Worse, when I first looked at the app in the Apple Store, it had 4.5 stars. Now that I look it up again, it is more like two stars. Something fishy going on.

title: Weird design not useful
text: Entire app has strange unusual design trying to be stylish while losing functionality. Colors have poor contrast making screens hard to read. Graphs are over curved showing unrealistic spikes rather than simple actual values. It’s hard to see a simple list of measurements. The scale can mess up and associate a weight reading with the wrong person. No way to fix that in the app. Can’t reassign a weight reading to another person no matter how obviously wrong it is. Instead this is a platform to advertise all sorts of extra Nokia services no one cares about. A basic functional app would be much better. Or if they insist on this stylish but poor design, at least fix contrast and add in basic functions.

title: Great App, wish iPad app was better
text:
This is a really great app, I have the scale and it really helps quantify weight loss and not only gives you good unique numbers quickly but with consistency. One thing that I always struggled with is getting the numbers from the same machine (ie body fat %) one device would tell me one thing and another a different. 

One improvement that I wish could happen is an improvement to their iPad app. It’s less of an app for iPad and more of an exact mirror of the iPhone app. Would be really cool to have this work on my iPad.

title: Best Wellness Tracking App EVER
text: I never give reviews but people need to know how much this app has to offer and how easy it is to use. I thought the app would just be able to log my numbers from my withings scale but I’m so impressed with how much it tells you about your health and how to improve. It integrates so well with my Apple Watch work out log and I just downloaded my fitness pal to see how logging food is. Great app can’t say enough. I’ll be recommending this scale and app to everyone I know.

title: Scale measures almost everything
text:
I’ve had the Withings scale for over a year. It measures everything except water weight very well. When I looked up why it doesn’t record water weight well, the help page indicated that dry skin on the feet were likely the culprit. Well, duh! Drinking enough water helps prevent dry skin. That’s why I need the information. 

As for the app, haven’t had huge issues. I like that the “daily” data goes back a couple of weeks to allow you to see trends. And the monthly view allows for a bigger picture. 

I sync information with my Apple Watch and haven’t noticed any issues there. 

This is the third brand of smart scale I have tried and it tracks the most information and has been the most accurate. 

Overall, even with the missed water weight issue, the scale and app rate 5 stars for me.

title: Allow users to edit sleep data since data is so inaccurate
text:
Can you please allow a user to change the sleep data in the app. 

Your device is useless when detecting sleep and often includes dramatically more sleep than actual. It seems to be a huge complaint with many customers when I searched for solutions through various forums. I also searched your website for a solution, which offers nothing. The ability to adjust the sleep time in the app would at least make this data useful if a user can manually edit to make it accurate. As annoying as that would be from a customer perspective, it could at least make the sleep data useful rather than complete throw away data due to it's inaccuracy.

title: Connectivity issues
text: The Nokia Body+ scale is awesome but it frequently has connectivity issues with the app. Some days it connects and transfers data, but most days it does not, so the data in the app is usually 1-2 days behind. It does eventually catch up and all the numbers are correct, just a little disappointing when you can see the graph data in real time. Otherwise, I love all the body information it produces. My doctors says these scales aren’t accurate, but any information better then no information!

title: The best!
text:
I have actually never written a review on the App Store before, but this app deserves some love. My husband and I first purchased our activité watches when it was called Withings about 3/4 years ago. We’ve seen the app transform once it was bought by Nokia. It’s had its hurdles, but I love it now!

Our family uses the Thermo, scale and my husband and I have the watches. As a mother, I can track everyone’s weight, height, fevers and our sleep patterns all under one app. I love it! 

Now, if they made kid sized watches, we’d be good to go!

title: Very nice weight, BP, and HR data summaries.
text: Very useful collection, display and summarization of data. Have been able to stop spreadsheet entry and analysis. Had some issues with BP cuff connectivity, but tech support was outstanding and have been able to easily expand manual data collection for easily understand and examine long range data trends by all levels of health professional from my supervising PA-C to my Arrhythmia specialist. Weekly summaries of weight, BP and HR are particularly useful to understand longer term changes and changes related to medications. Outstanding graphs.

title: Currently less functional
text:
I have had this app and a steel hr for a while. One of the best “non-health” benefits is the notifications feature. In the last day or so my notifications do not come through. I turn blue tooth on and off. Restart the phone. Quit the app. Restart the app. Turn on and off notifications. And all this is very spotty as to if the notifications will come to life. 

As a health app it is good, though I do wonder what else is not working properly. I like the looks and function of the watch but less so now that notifications are not working. Will have to get a different one, maybe finally buy the Apple Watch instead.

title: My favorite smart watch & scale
text:
I am a fan. I love to see feedback lead to improvements. Every morning I look at the app to see how well I slept. That feature has greatly improved over the past year or so - much more accurate. I wish it could track naps but I rarely do nap.

I have the Withings HR watch and i love that it looks like a nice analog watch and yet it has the smart watch features discreetly nestled in the face. I got so tired of the ugly highly popular fitness watch that I literally had to have replaced 6x in two years as it fell apart in various ways. My Withings is sturdy, attractive and tracks the data I want.

I also have a scale & though data can be inconsistent, it gives me a good basis for knowing how I am doing with weight, fat, muscle - and the day’s weather!

PS I have always found Withings customer support to be helpful and responsive.

title: Could be better like the Previous Withings App
text:
I can tell Nokia is trying to improve the apps, but there still is room for improvement. It would be nice to have a “notes” section that you can additional information on a night’s sleep details in both the app and the browser page. Also an option to edit a night’s sleep and other activity if your watch or sleep tracking device did not correctly record when you went to bed and fell asleep. Need more graphs and trends for heart rate as well. 
Please either bring back the original Withings app or at least make it as good and user friendly.

title: Wish I had done it sooner
text:
I bought a cheaper scale and went with a competitors app recently and it was awful. Their scale was inaccurate and when I gave them feedback about accessibility and legible font sizes I was ignored.

In beautiful contrast the Withings app is more friendly, it let me federate auth with my AppleID, supports dark mode, and has a really legible and friendly UI.

Thank you for your hard work and clear attention to making this fit with the Apple ecosystem like any good iOS app should!

title: So much health info - please add water aerobics!!!
text: I have been using this app for about 2 years and love how much health and well-being information it gives me. So comprehensive and better with each release.  I have tracked over 25 lbs in weight loss. Reflect on my weight history often - it has been a year since I was overweight!  Now focusing on healthy % fat in my body composition. **Please add water aerobics to the workouts.** my only peeve about this app. I run in the pool and it records me as walking. Thank you!

title: 8 years of Withings
text: I started using my Withings Wi-Fi scale in September of 2012 and I’m still using the same one every day in 2020. The app has seen a lot of changes over time, but I think that overall that it does what it is meant to do with new features being included to benefit users. There is also an Apple Watch app, and I think the notifications from both are helpful. Whenever my current scale eventually stops working, I plan to buy Withings again

title: Good, but needs work
text:
This system works pretty good, but the app needs a little work. Since installing a scale, I get the same message notification twice every time I open the app, no matter what I do. Second, it really needs ability to write data to Apple Health, not just read from it.

Update to developer. Have tried reinstalling but the ability to write data to Apple Health is a permissions issue in your programming. In Apple Health settings your app is only set up to read data. You guys have the ability, with all of your devices, to collect a lot of useful data, but it would be great to add in WRITE SUPPORT for Apple Health.

title: Used to be good
text: App and products used to be good. I even bought their pricy scale to help manage my weight and keep track of my heart health. Then in one fell swoop the scale doesn’t work for heart health anymore and never will and the app doesn’t sync with the health app anymore either all without any notification. They say I can send them my scale back for a refund but want my bank account number to give to a third party to do a wire transfer. I don’t think I so. When I emailed them about not wanting to give them my bank account information they said that was the only way to get a refund and tough luck basically. I really feel like they just stole my money. I will forever avoid any company that does business with Nokia or withings as they used to be called.

title: Doesn’t transfer all sleep info to Apple Health
text:
I was looking at my Apple Health “Sleep” sleep recorded data and noticed that it only has part of the data for a night. If I get up in the middle for a bit, it only shows that I slept the first part (before getting up). But, just to be confusing it logs many “Asleep” periods after I supposedly got up. For example, it shows “In bed” from 9:59 pm - 5:13 am, but then has sleep periods (totaling over 90 minutes) after 5:13 am. It’s quite a mess, some periods are duplicated, and show as added to Apple Health 3 hours apart.

Who knows what is actually trustworthy?

title: Some good.  Some not
text: This app is great at interfacing with the Nokia devices and keeping track of your vitals.  But they have hyped the additional coached “programs” like their “better body” program in which they suggest changes in habits and issue grades each week depending on your compliance.   That would be fine but the app doesn’t know if or when you’ve done something (like working out) even if you log it in.  Not very encouraging if you are doing what they say but the app gives you a failing grade.    Need to fix that.

title: Good scale, app having issues
text: A recent change to the app when viewing my weight defaults to all measurements, not month or any view I leave it on. It always defaults to all measurements. When I select month, it focuses on the first month with measurements, for me that is February 2015. Then I have to scroll the way to this month. Why was the view changed to default no matter what to all measurements and not left up to user to customize? For example when I check my progress show me the last view I looked at?

title: Twisting hands
text:
I’ve never tried the Withing Body+ scale I bought. I didn’t get the chance to.

In order to operate the scale it needs to know your WiFi password and to connected to Internet.

What’s even worse is that the only way to use the scale is to accept that they will take your data on their servers.

There is nothing special about my weight or body fat. Yet I feel it’s completely unacceptable that they may decide it’s ok to say we must have your data (whatever the explanation) without giving you a chance to opt out.

It is that soft twisting of hands where it seems ok to force the client to surrender privacy with well, they bought the scale, so they probably like it and besides if they don’t accept the scale have to be returned and since that’s unpleasant the client will surrender privacy.

The only way I know to teach an invasive corporations to respect their client is to hit them in the pocket. The control of our privacy tomorrow depends on how we teach them today. It makes sense not to buy their products or return them until they change their policies.

title: Review of Health Mate App
text: I use this app primarily to track my sleep and how many steps I walk each day along with monitoring my weight. All of these have work flawlessly. The other activity that I use is for my daily swims. This is one area that improvement is still needed. The app gets my time and calories burned correct each and every time correct. It, however does not get the distance at all. Swim only one stroke in a 25 yard pool. Waiting on my replacement for the Nokia HR watch. Been promised that this will take care of the shortcomings.

title: Waiting for Health Sync
text:
This app takes its sweet time syncing my Body+ readings to Health—generally I don’t get today’s results synced until tomorrow, assuming I didn’t forget to reopen the app after the last restart. 

Ideally, this would sync whenever the app is explicitly opened, but if not, it needs a sync button. The whole “if six hours etc etc” is great for background processing but totally inappropriate for foreground usage. I don’t need my readings rate limited.

This is annoying enough to suggest buying a different scale, which isn’t awesome because I remember this working much better before.

title: I can never get the stupid thing to sync
text: I have resorted to just manually adding my weight since it never sends it. It has sent exactly once. You can’t force a send. You can “retrieve unknown measurements… but there are literally none there… even though the scale even said my name after it took the measurements. I have used the Bluetooth function. I added it to my wife…. Ugh!!!! You can’t sync them as it’s weighing you. I’ve followed all the instructions. I’m fairly tech savvy and this is just way too complicated. I gave it two stars… bc the scale does take weight. It just won’t send the info. Definitely thinking about getting another scale.

title: Wouldn’t let me write a bad review!
text:
Very slow to send data to its own app, let alone Apple Health. When it asked me to review the app, I gave it one star for that reason and it DISABLED the submit button. This is immoral design and against Apple’s design guides. It also asks for way too much data on sign up. The scale is fine but the software stinks.
(Withings responded to this review asking me to make a support ticket. I will not.)
All I want is a dumb wifi scale that tells Apple Health what my weight is; I have no interest in some random company holding my health data hostage if I don’t let them be the lynchpin of my health and wellness. And why trust Withings? The app doesn’t even do the one thing I want (take my weight and give it to Apple Health).

title: Fails at 14mmHg Every Time
text: After years of using my WiFi BP cuff, it recently stopped working with app through constant repositioning, new batteries, different people arms, uninstalling/reinstalling app, pairing and different device....all same failed results. The BP cuff is paired. The app recognizes it’s on. Click start. Cuff tightens up to a point and decompressed although down to 14mmHg and pauses. Can’t escape out. Stop button not working. Have to close the app and reopen. Same failure happens every time. Was a loyal Withings customer (scale, fitness band, baby cam, BP cuff wired and wireless) What have you done Nokia? Going to buy a new Qardio or Omron. Will not buy another Withings product. Huge fail. Where’s the support that was once a call away?

title: Needs improvement.
text: I absolutely adore my Steel HR. It’s beautiful and simple and does everything I want. But the app is a little tough to use and doesn’t have an option to view my data in a meaningful way. For example, I’d like to view all of my running times for the past month in one place to see how I’ve improved, rather than swiping through one day at a time. Same with all the other stats. Even the option to see my steps “for the whole month” is pretty useless. Sorry guys, hate to say it but Fitbit does this significantly better than you do right now...

title: Worse than the original Withings app
text:
I bought a Withings scale and was happy at the time. But Nokia bought Withings and now everything is worse. Never buying from Nokia/Withings again. 
1. My scale no longer syncs my weigh-ins to the cloud, so I need to ent my all my entries manually. This defeats the whole reason I spent so much on a scale in the first place. 
2. The app “vibrates” my phone unnecessarily when I’m just zooming in and out of my weight graph. 
3. The weight graph, in addition to being less attractive, no longer lets me zoom in the amount I want. You can only view your weight by the year, quarter, or month. The old Withings app let you view your weight at any granularity you wanted to. Why buy a company and then make their products worse?!? I don’t get it.

title: Learning so much
text: Such a great app because it keeps you motivated by tracking your data that is understandable and easy to read. If it isn’t understandable then there is help guides to explain what your looking at and why it is important. This is how I learned about the importance of tracking muscle mass in regards to body weight loss. Never knew why that was important before and didn’t even have a way to track it. Now I know and more importantly, I know why. Thank you

title: Doesn't even deserve 0 stars.
text: Nokia bring back the old app. This new garbage app is useless and buggy with significantly less functionality than the last version of the Withings app. I purchased a smart scale at 10x what I could by a dumb non integrated scale for. Without a good functional app I overpaid by 1,000%. I want a functional app back or my money for my scale back!!! Has gone from bad to worse with the latest update. Body fat, muscle mass, and bone mass is now expressed as pounds instead of as a percentage of body weight. Especially considering that all the available commercial health literature and weight loss guides those figures are always expressed as percentages. NOKIA YOU ARE GOING BACKWARDS. RE BRAND THE LAST VERSION OF THE WITHINGS APP AND RE RELEASE IT!!!!

title: Good app, but health sync is too slow
text:
Overall this app is great, as are the products that go with it (I use their smart scale & blood pressure cuff). But unfortunately the app does not reliably write your health data to apple health. I find I have to open the app and leave it open for 5-10 min before it will sync the data back. This is very, very annoying. It didn’t used to have this bug, but I think introduced it a couple years ago.

I posted a thread asking about this on their support site but did not get a reply.

title: Do not purchase this cuff!
text:
I never write reviews, but this cuff is terrible and I felt the need to warn others.  

To its credit, it did work reasonably well at first, but always had a problem with needing to repeat measurements.

After further updates it kept having connectivity problems and at this point will not connect to my phone at all.   Everything is updated and batteries are good.  The device turns itself off before the Bluetooth has a chance to discover it.  Even back when it was paired with my phone, it would lose connectivity and not be able to discover and connect with the device.

Reading other reviews, it seems that this problem is not unique.  I hope they get it fixed soon, but I will be looking elsewhere for a bp monitor.

Feeling a little sore after spending $99 for a poorly designed paper weight.

title: If you’re in the Withings ecosystem of products, it’s great!
text: Well designed but I would LOVE to see additional app integrations. Strava, Strong, and other fitness apps. Runkeeper is good but there are certainly other options. Just look at all the integrations in My Fitness Pal! Would also be nice if the running activity on the Steel HD communicated directly with Runkeeper so you didn’t have to reopen the Health Mate app to get GPS and VO2 Max scores. Just a little clunky. I’d certainly be willing to pay for various upgrade features in that regard if they were ever implemented. Otherwise, solid, well designed app.

title: Privacy Policy: Abusive collection of personally identifiable data
text:
I only wanted a scales that delivers data into Apple‘s HealthKit - but that requires the Health Mate App and leaves you with no other options than to accept Withings’ Privacy Policies: 

They are collecting and storing an enormous amount of directly, personally identifiable information which simply is not necessary! It‘s poor privacy policy design and that‘s not just a minor thing.

Guys - make your app work without forcing your customers to give you all these very personal data.
If you need to sync health data across devices and multiple family members, this can be done via encryption and/or anonymized identities. But you are not the epicenter of our health, identity and data: Give us the option to opt-out without rendering HealthKit unusable.

Let me know if there‘s a way to accomplish this and I‘ll happily update my review.

title: Insightful Data
text: I love the data details of fat, muscle,  and water percentages this scale provides. This helps me fine tune my workouts and diet to get the percentages I want. Weight gain was not great news until I saw the breakdown this scale gave... it was actually muscle weight! My fiancé and I both use the same scale, it can even tell who is standing in it. The scale has never messed up, I’ve never had issues technical or other with it, and we have both used the scale multiple times a week for a year and a half!

had to turn off HealthKit integration because it was breaking my other apps.

title: Works As advertised
text:
If you don't like this app, you either don't know how to use it or your just______. (Pick a word)

This product provides excellent information to both Google and Apple Health via this app. This app completes everything you need to keep track of your weight and BMI. title: Subpar App
text: The app isn't as comprehensive as I'd like. One night I woke up at 3am and fell back asleep. The app rated the first part of my sleep with a score of 20 and labeled the second part as a nap--I'd expect it to know this was one entire night log. The food consumption is linked to MyFitnessPal (free or pay to remove apps). I'm having trouble linking my food logs in MyFitnessPal to my Health App. When I log exercises on my Health app through my Steel HR, it doesn't link back to My FitnessPal. It makes me want to go back to fitbit but I love the steel HR so am torn.

title: Used everyday for over a year
text: I’ve used the app with scales, blood-pressure cuff, thermometer, and oxygen reader everyday for over a year. I’ve been very impressed and used my own health data to lower my weight, understand the effects of stress, and avoid getting ill by carefully watching trends. I’d like to see sports watches, such as Garmin integrated, as I’d like to have the app count my steps from exercising, rather than just my phone. It does count the physical activity, so it’s close.

title: Two kinds of technology companies
text:
There are two kinds of tech companies in the market today. The kind that innovate and create compelling software and products, and the kind that can’t and buy up smaller companies that can. Nokia is the failing sort that buys up smaller companies. This app, and it’s connected health devices, were wonderful under Withings. Since the Nokia purchased Withings the app has been rewritten and made considerably worse, and now they have removed the key feature from their flagship smart scale. 

Dear customer, let us keep taking things from you and see how low your expectations go. 

Well Nokia, they can’t get much lower. Hopefully what’s left of you folds up ingloriously soon so you can’t ruin any more innovative products.

title: Crashes all the time - issue resolved
text:
I had to manually delete the app and all the data and then download the app again from the App Store and that fixed the problem. Appreciate the response by the developer. 

Original message:
This new app keeps on crashing. Every time I open it, it crashes. I restarted my iPhone and still the same. All the data from withing’s weight machine this is not getting sync’ed with Apple health app.

title: Buggy and poorly supported
text:
I waited a long time for a fitness tracker that looked like a reasonably stylish analog watch.    The Steel HR does that.  

Health Mate — the companion app for the watch and other devices, is a constant disappointment.  

Bugs are extraordinarily slow to get fixed and recents updates have made viewing my data less convenient.  The new dashboard view is much less helpful than the timeline and I wish I could have that as the default view.

The app continues to send notifications of outgoing calls to the watch.  I don’t need or want a notification that I’m calling someone as I’m pretty aware of it when I do.

For some reason, I can graph my height over time but not temperature.

Sleep tracking is spotty at best.  The app cannot distinguish laying down and watching TV from sleeping and also routinely misses awakenings.

 Lastly customer support is poor.

I want to love this app, but Withings seems determined to prevent that.

title: Bugs when syncing to Apple Health
text: I see this app was recently updated to fix some bugs but it seems like there are still bugs present. I just set up my new withings body plus scale to auto sync with Apple health. When I enter my height in Health Mate profile, it shows a different height in Apple health by decimal places. I even tried changing the units from lbs to cm to see if that would make a difference it throws off value populating in Apple health even more.  Hoping this can be fixed soon. This makes me question the accuracy of all data being synced over to Apple health.

title: Good for records but limitations
text: I use this to keep track of my health measurements especially blood pressure. Reports are very limited, you cannot get just one month of data. You can't send the monthly data to the printer. The only option sends to be email to yourself. Doing this eliminates all the cookie alerts and there is no graph. The csv data exports fine but the Excel spreadsheet cannot be opened with the current version (corrupt data or headers). I tried numerous times over the week with the same error every time.

title: No Landscape mode on iPad
text: That this app still does not support landscape mode on an iPad is simply infuriating. I reached out to their support about it, and I could not even make them understand the issue. They seemed to be unaware of the difference between portrait and landscape mode. To have a portrait only mode means having to rotate your iPad to an atypical orientation to use the app. PLEASE FIX THIS! Another issue is that there no longer is a way to graph one’s heart rate. This used to be a feature, but a major update in recent years removed it. Otherwise I would have rated the app much higher.

title: Constant connection problems
text: While the Body Analyzer + scale and HealthMate mobile app are OK independently, there seems to be many issues with connectivity and syncing between the two products. I have to constantly disassociate / disconnect the pairing and go through the process of connecting the two products. It has been an ongoing issue for many many months and doesn’t seem like there’s any effort to address. I have a looked for solutions online and on their FAQs, but have not been able to find anything to help address the issues.

title: History has changed after updates: Bad!
text: I’ve been using this for over a year and I’ve been pleased. Now for the last week or so after I weigh and open the app to see my weight trends, it shows my entire history (All) and not the current Month as it used to. So when I touch the Month button, it starts at the beginning and I have to swipe all the way through some 500 measurements to see my current progress. I’m not happy at all. I’ve checked the settings and I can’t find how to default to month view. Please fix this!

title: Excellent Privacy, solid product
text:
I returned an Omron blood pressure cuff largely because of the privacy policy - Omron specifically states that they will sell your data to third parties for directed advertising and other purposes. Their compliance with opt-out is painful and difficult to do. 

Withings has a solid privacy policy with a simple statement that they will not sell your data. 

For health products, that’s important. Your data is yours. You buy a product, you should not be the product.

title: Activity details are completely inaccurate
text: Activity details are completely inaccurate. I usually walk with my dogs 2 times a day. The shorter distance never takes lessa than 30 minutes. The app sometimes not even register that or register 9 minutes walk. The longer walk usually consists of 1 hour walk with a stop in the middle. Once again, the app registers just one part of the walk with fewer time.... Really wanted to like it but currently is not possible! :(

title: Products
text:
I for one have not had any issues with the Withings products. I have purchased most of their products and have had a good response from them. I am waiting for the new watch to be available here in the states. For customer service issues I have not run into issues with them as some may have.
I wish the products could be merged in the data transfer to the FitBit products which I also use.

title: Review if healthmate and steel hr
text:

text: I can’t even count how many times I’ve had to reconnect to Wi-Fi. It’s charting my data for days and weeks, then it stops and I don’t realize it until much later by that time the process to reconnect has changed and it takes an immense amount of time to reconnect. Often times I have to remove the devices completely from my phone and start from scratch again. However I must say the features are great if only you can count on them actually communicating with your phone

text:

title: Works great!
text: I use this app with my scale and blood pressure monitor and it has helped me improve on both. I do wish that the weighted line on the weight graphs worked more like the website version. If you compare them, you will see that the app line is not really weighted correctly. I also wish they both would allow the user to see the current weighted value. title: Needs improvements but developers are hard at work
text:
Hi,
Ive had the steel hr for several years now to replace my previously owned garmin forerunner with an additional rhythm + heart rate monitor. 
Initially, i was very unhappy with the accuracy of steel hr's real time heart rate tracking and accuracy as it was way off manually measurements (which was close to garmin, rhythm plus setup) because hear rate tracking was one of my main reasons to buy the steel hr, in addition to the long battery life.

title: I love my Steel HR watch and the app except for one thing.
text:
I love my Steel HR watch and the app except for one thing: The digital display on the watch is too dim to use outside in any kind of light, including shade. Unless it’s darker than normal outside, I can never read the display while out. Seems like there ought to be a way to brighten this up. text: My experiences have been positive. I own and use the high-end bathroom scale, blood pressure machine, and sleep monitor. All three work well, with no problems. The only issue is the scale seems to give readings for certain things (body fat, water, muscle, etc) that I don’t quite trust. text: I bought the Withings wireless blood pressure cuff from the online Apple store so that I could record daily blood pressure readings on my phone without a lot of hassle. I was and still am willing to pay for a straightforward app to do that with the cuff. The only reasons I still give it 3 stars are because of the looks of the unit, being able to swim with it, and the excellent battery life of the Withings Activite Steel.

title: Waste of time and money
text: I bought this scale based on the recommendation of a friend. I should have just gone to WalMart and saved myself some grief and money. The scale doesn’t know which person is on the scale even though I follow instructions. And if you are obese and really need help you will not get it from this company. I am so done with this app. I am removing it from my mobile device and from my pc. Save your money!!

title: Easy Peasy :)

As for customer service...well emails do go unanswered forcing me to the internet too find a solution. Seems to be a common complaint with tech support generally. Perhaps it’s an opportunity to practice self determination and personal responsibility . :)

title: Does this thing ever work correctly?
text: I take a measurement, it doesn’t show up in the app. I take another one to be sure. Still doesn’t show up. This happens a dozen times, I finally give up and enter it manually. Then three days later I get a notification that there are “13 unassigned measurements.” If the device ever gets dropped from WiFi, the app completely forgets who I am. text:

text:

However, the app has had consistent problems - some days the weight doesn’t sync & now it’s the steps that haven’t been syncing. For a new product, I don’t want to spend my time hanging out on Internet forums trying to troubleshoot basic data syncing issues.

title: Does not work as promised
text: This watch has two different times, the digital display is about 3-4 minutes faster than the watch hands. It will not stay connected to my phone, so I can’t rely on it to notify me of a new message if my phone is on silent. I can go for a walk with my husband and he will have at least a thousand more steps than I and we have the same stride. As for the sleep portion, I usually get up, go to the bathroom, feed the cat and open the app. Only when I open the app does it say I woke up. I have had this watch since September 2018, and all I can rely on is its alarm clock. Unless the watch has a completely drained battery, the alarm clock works.

title: Data visualization is awful
text:
Visualization of health data in this app is truly bad. Data is not updated automatically in the background.

The authors of this app make all the classic data viz mistakes, and then some. Which is a shame, because data viz was good before Nokia acquired the app. 

Frankly, there’s too much to cover in an App Store review. 

For example, the trend lines make no sense. It looks like some sort of attempt (emphasis on attempt) at spline fitting, when a simple moving average or autoregressive smoothing would be more appropriate. Further, the trend line tends to “lead” the actual data points.  Finally, the trend line tends to be biased to one side of the noise in the trend (which means that the parameters are totally inappropriate if they ARE using an autoregressive model for the trend line)

Another complaint: The y-axis of data plots is not configurable, so small changes look like huge trends (or vice versa). 

Lastly, why doesn’t the app update data in the background?  I have to manually refresh the data each time I open the app.  Do the developers not know that it’s 2019?

title: Keeps Me Motivated...
text: I love love LOVE this app! First thing it's totally FREE ! Next is that with all the badges and how accurately it keeps track of so many different functions I find myself checking my stats frequently and always wanting to be sure that I've reached the next badge or goal I've set for myself. I find the badges and notifications very motivating and something to look forward to and take them as additional encouragement for completing goals and working towards getting healthy again. ~GREAT APP ! ~

title: Simple, easy to use
text:

She has the Steel HR and I use the Steel. 
We have found these devices to be accurate in measuring our walking and sleep activities, which is all we want to track. No frills, easy to use and the devices don’t burden us with a lot of extra “bells and whistles,” though other features are available if we chose to use them.

text: I have had withings for some years and their first scale was buggy as the scale would not change the weights from metric to imperial. I got the body plus. Now the app will not allow you change from metric to imperial. I have going into settings reset my scale, and I have deleting profile and history just to change to imperial. I’ll keep using the blood pressure device, but the last of their products after so many years. I need something that just “works” the first time. G*****n here I come.

title: Love your Scale but I’m downvoting your App for Now
text:
I’ve been a user of your scale for years now and until now I’ve been loving the app as well. However, after your last several updates it’s way too difficult to view the body composition numbers that are the linchpin and cornerstone of what your scale does so well. Please get that fixed I know you can because I’ve read that information religiously for years now.
