title: Exceptionally customer focused
text: I have been a user of Withings products for many years now and what always made me come back, but also bring more people on board is the exceptional service and the amazing response to user feedback. I have seen my feedback being implemented in future versions, which is showing great response to the users. I would definitely recommend the app and the products.

title: My records from within the year have been completely lost
text: Apparently there was an upgrade in the app yesterday. I loved The original app, which kept a chart of my weight from the very beginning Of my using the app-which had been for more than a year. Suddenly yesterday, all of my weight records and my weight chart for more than a year completely disappeared from the app. Also, I have been keeping records of daily steps for more than a year. All of my records for steps have disappeared-except for those in approximately the past 30 days.   I am very disappointed that this app, which I used religiously, has become completely undependable And has lost all of the records which I have accumulated.

title: Fine start but missing key features
text:
Pros: 

- The app is pretty.
- Charts look really nice.
- Scale’s syncing against different profiles in our house is effortless.

Cons:
- Doesn’t write to Apple Health.
- Difficult to change display of historical data that I want to see.

I’ve got the Health Mate app because we bought a Nokia scale a few months ago. The app is a fine way to see basic info. 

The lack of 2-way Apple Health connectivity is really disappointing. If I’d understood that I would have likely bought a different scale. I’d really like to get a Steel HR watch, but Nokia’s decision to keep my data and not allow it to sync out means I can’t. I’ll probably end up buying an Apple Watch instead, which is a shame because I think the Steel and Steel HR watches are really sharp.

It’s a simple feature to implement (and, as I understand, used to be a part of the app before Nokia rebranded it). I don’t like my information locked up by a single company and can’t at this time support Nokia’s business choice with further purchases.

title: Contiously same problems
text: I have been on your product and app since 2013. Products by design are great, except they do not work consistently. I like to track my fitness data. Can you imagine of how annoying it is to lose data compliments of Withings Nokia and diluting your actual activities? And the baby/ children scale bought years ago never worked properly. Tried contact multiple times but no success. When Withings was still owning the product it was better. Finally broke down and bought an Apple watch. Too bad that I will be losing five years of data. C’est la vie

title: Don’t buy Nokia products until they fix their apps
text:
I’ve been a loyal withings customer. It’s been over a year since Nokia bought withings and put their regressive, bug filled, low functionality, bad UI app in place of the withings app.

Many key aspects of the scale no longer work to sync with the app anymore. The accuracy is coming into question. I’m not sure why anyone at Nokia isn’t taking the withings app and reviving it at this point with a different logo. Many customers are jumping ship and it may not be long until I do as well.

title: Apple sign in
text: I can’t believe this app could get worse than it already was and of course tech-support is of no use. Now I’m having sign in issues. First the app wanted me to reset my passwordBut they wouldn’t accept my Apple password so I went to the website and it said it sent me an email but of course it didn’t. So I went back to the app and tried to reset my password but never got an email again. Had to reset the app several times to finally sign in with Apple and then it froze when trying to link to apple health. Health Insights still not working although many have brought up this issue and of course they haven’t responded in the forum.

title: Please update for iOS 12
text: I’ve been using this app for over five years mainly to track my weight and track my steps. Since I updated my iPhone to iOS12, the app has stopped working completely. It does not count steps any more. I have tried removing and reinstalling logging out and back in etc. but nothing works. I’m still giving it a five star rating because it has been awesome until now but I’m giving you guys a chance to fix the problem.

title: Withings app
text:
I appreciate the app; but...
1. I’m allergic to the watch band and I’ve noticed that watch has a lower number than my iPhone and the watch overrides the iPhone...that should be fixed please...I don’t know if the watch can read correctly through my rash or if Withings app doesn’t like the iPhone health app...
2. Where can I ask about the watch band? I took pictures to show you the reaction with my arm and watch band!
Please and Thank You...

title: Sync is poor
text: The info doesn’t automatically sync on it’s own like the past. I had an older scale years ago that just worked. I got a new on this year and redownloaded the app and gave it all the permissions. The weight doesn’t sync from the scale to the app unless I manually refresh and force it to. Then it doesn’t sync to apple health until I remove its access and give it back. This is a horrible experience. If I didn’t have to do all that each time it would be an easy 5 as I like all the other scale features.

title: Works well with Apple Watch
text:
I have a Withings Scale and blood pressure setup, but it’s great this app works so well with a product that isn’t even theirs. It keeps track of weekly and weekly step totals in a format better than Apples health app. 

Thanks for playing nice when you don’t have to. 

I do wish this app didn’t lose part of a days data whenever it updates. Doesn’t remove it from the phone, just from within the app itself. Not a huge problem.

title: WiFi stopped working
text: WiFi on my scale stopped working. It’s less than two years old. I see no way to contact these people. Keep getting looped around to one useless article after another. How about some customer support? Their support email address is apparently not valid anymore. Crappy way to run a business. If I could give zero stars, I would because this isn’t the first time I’ve had problems with their products/support.

title: Will often erroneously track wrong events
text:
Overall works well with the Steel HR Sport watch that I have, but it often tracks and adds random sport sessions that it says it has detected, but does so erroneously. 

Can’t seem to find an option to turn this type of feature off, so I constantly have to be deleting the sports sessions it adds.

Also... it should have some basic built in validation for the step counter. I was on a bumpy road for multiple days on a road trip, but driving decently fast... pretty sure it’s not normal to be taking steps at 30 mph for 2-3 hours at a time.

title: Great idea terrible technology
text: I have the scale and first off the app is terrible doesn’t work I had to delete it and re-download just for it to stop glitching. I had to create a whole new account after it thought my sister was me and recorded all of her information into my account under my name and wouldn’t let me delete it. It honestly works better for androids than iPhones ironic since most of the world uses Apple 🙄. Anyway it’s not worth it because you can’t even read your information out correctly from the app there’s honestly probably just something else out there that does the same thing but actually works.

title: Nice watch
text: I like that it tracks and looks like a regular watch. Workouts have been accurate and the tracking for my runs is great. My only complaint is the text alerts rarely work. They haven’t for months now. I’ve contact customer service so many times about it hoping I could get support with the 1 year warranty but they just kept telling me they were hoping the next update would resolve the issue. So, for now I I’ve been waiting about a year for this update that is suppose to be fixing the issue.

title: Features in app not working
text: Purchased the scale and noticed they have some really cool features within the app which apply to pregnancy, better sleep, healthier heart, leader board with family members and a better body. I have updated the apps, and from day one, consistently get an error when I try to utilize the Better Body feature. The error says they’re working on it and it’ll be back shortly, yet never does. This is very frustrating as I was really looking forward to using that app along with another I have. Wish there was a time frame other than “shortly” which we could expect it back since what shortly means to you might mean something entirely different to someone else.

title: Love the watches!  Get lots of admiring comments
text: App works as advertised. When I first got the first watch not everything in watch app worked with my older phone. Communicated via email and they could not fix immediately but did do within a week.  Updates have worked well. I like the connected GPS, the heart rate options, the many sports options, and that they are now updating the sleep element.

title: Nokia ruined this device!
text: I purchased this to pair with my IPhone. Worked flawlessly while Withings owned it. Every since Nokia acquired this app it’s been problems month after month. I don’t have time nor should I have to contact admin to give feedback on this device. They should use device whether they need it or not to stay in tune with function of their interest. I would love to try others devices but I’m not going to based solely on my experience with the blood pressure monitor. Difficult to get an accurate blood pressure reading when multiple attempts are required for this device to function properly. High blood pressure is a frustrating result from using this product.

title: Inconsistent
text: I have used Health Mate for several devices and have had to work through constant bugs or failures. At this time the App freezes when syncing my Pulse HR exercises with Apple ACTIVITY for workouts. App also causes Apple Activity and Apple Health to freeze. Each time I workout my Health Mate record incomplete data on the Home page but correct data on Workout page. And when syncing with Apple Activity both apps freeze. Every workout requires a complete Shutdown, power-off on my phone and restart, in order to sync.

title: Syncing issues
text: I am writing a review specifically about the app and how it syncs with my watch. Anytime I capture a walking activity, the distance and calories are not captured accurately in the app (I wear a chest strap to compare workout activities). Immediately after finishing a walk, the app freezes and kicks me out if I try to view the dashboard. Also anytime I attempt to click the walking activity to view more details the app freezes and kicks me out. I do not experience this issue with other activities like dancing, yoga, hiking, fitness etc.

title: Limited integration with Apple Health
text:
Overall this is a nice app but it’s biggest limitation is it’s integration with Apple Health. Total steps, running and walking workouts are displayed in the app but other workouts like weight training are not. Also the running distance displayed in the app is consistently less that what my Apple Watch recorded, sometimes as much as half a mile.

If you’re looking for an app that provides a holistic view of your overall health and fitness this app falls far short.

If you want an app to track body weight and body fat it’s a great tool.

title: Well done
text: App works well... but defaults to % changes rather than actual values. After getting assistance to resolve displayed values, I’m very happy. Contacted tech support which was a bit arduous in the app going through multiple menus to get to a page I could send a request then realizing I had to leave and get my serial number before finding my way back to ask for help in a registered app with my product information already available to be sent?

title: But...
text: The app is pretty great, but I wish there was a function to add in sleep because the tracker doesn’t always register a nap (no matter what time of day) and once or twice hasn’t started tracking sleep till 2 or 3 hours in. My biggest but with this nokia package product however is the watch and how it doesn’t keep time accurately. You have to keep synchronizing to keep the time accurate and, honestly, it can take 2 or 3 minutes for that happen and a watch that doesn’t keep time is not.. helpful

title: Simple and easy to use scale
text: There’s no cheating this baby. You step on it and it sends all the information straight to your app. It tells you the numbers so you don’t have to second-guess anything. Allows me to concentrate on putting the healthiest food in my mouth and meeting my activity goals. That’s why I give it five stars. The easier the program is to follow, the easier it is for me to follow through.

title: Sleep time should be over a 24 hour period.
text:
Update: the app does a terrible job of keeping up with the amount of sleep a person gets. It only records part of it. I’m lowering my rating. You guys need to fix the app. There’s also now a problem with the scale putting the weight on the wrong person. There doesn’t appear to be any way to move it to the right person. The sleep time doesn’t include multiple sleep times during the day. It should include all sleeping during a 24 hour period. Like from midnight to midnight or noon to noon.

 I like the charts on the Wiscale iPad app better. The trend line doesn't work. It's about two weeks behind.

title: Most Improved
text: I’ve been using the scale for five years and liked it from the start. However, initially the app was flaky and support nonexistent. Then Nokia took over and things went from bad to worse. But since Withings regained control the improvement has been dramatic. The app now works flawlessly both for the scale and also for the Withings blood pressure cuff which I also use. All are highly recommended.

title: Nice app but recurring problems
text:
I have used the app for years now however my weight keeps being input into the app every time I get home and connect to the WiFi so I have multiple weight duplicates. The nutrition info via MFP keeps unlinking or doesn’t update within the HealthMate app. 

Otherwise, I love the products you all have to offer and wish I had a use to use the others you all have for sale.

title: Not bad, but sometimes it gets confused
text: It’s a fairly decent app.  However, it gets confused sometimes about what you are doing.  Any time I’m on my tractor, it thinks I’m riding a bike and tracks my mileage.  The iPhone also gets called mouses, but Apple give you the ability to edit out the erroneous data.  I haven’t yet found any way to correct the record.  I can delete an activity, but it keeps the steps and mileage. A little arrogant of it thinking it is always right and could never make a mistake - we have a President like that.

title: App will not pair and features going backwards
text:
I echo GeoPix issue that after many versions of iOS and well into version 3.x of this software, the SINGLE SELLING POINT of the scale — to track your weight with HealthKit — is a failure. 

I nearly purchased a new scale, thinking it might solve the problem, and the promise of “pulse wave” was exciting — but in the latest software update 3.3.1 - Pulse Wave has been removed as a feature!

Shame Nokia, I am done buying your products. Good luck with the phone business.

title: I miss withings!!
text: We were upset when withings went away but decided to give this app a try.. It isn’t very user friendly. The graph is hard to read and there’s no box in the bottom right corner that gives you the BMI reading, fat percentage etc with arrows so you can navigate across the graph easily like withings did. Several of my weights are missing and it will do one or two current weights on the list view and then gets into weights from 4 months before so you have to go to the graph to see what you weighed three days ago and it’s difficult to get it to line up so you can see what the weight is.  I hope they improve it soon or we will be finding another option.

title: Defective pairing/synchronization capability
text: If you are looking for a scale which will be paired with a corresponding app to keep track of your measurements, then this is not the scale for you. I have followed up the instructions provided by Support numerous times and it seems you need to repeat set up Every. Single. Time. The scale does not pair to my phone, which I place right next to the turned on scale. Waste of time! I have already contacted Support and just get the same instructions.

title: Integrations faulty - phantom users
text:
Meh! App is okay but they say it should connect to myfitnesspal and it just will not do it. I’ve connected the accounts but it just says zero. So frustrating. We also have added two users to our scale but there is a third user’s initials there that we can not figure out where they came from or how to get rid of them. They show up every time we weigh. 🤷🏼‍♂️
—— reply to developer: Ive tried all this. The troubleshooting steps don’t do anything. The feature just doesn’t work. I’ve also tried several times to contact support. No help at all.

title: Nice app but needs some adjustments
text: I purchased the Withings Body+ smart scale which is really nice and I do recommend except that this app has some problems that need adjusted. Such as for weight being able to zoom in further on your weight progress (it’s limited to a month) a week - 2 week period would be really nice. It also doesn’t even sync all of the data it records with the health app. Lean muscle mass is the big one. It records but doesn’t send to Apple health. Both of these should be easy fixes yet still nothing.

title: Straight fwd and clean info
text: The only reason why I’m missing the fifth star is the lack of social connection and/or gamification presence. Fitbit makes this their primary focus, and I feel that I’d be more motivated to check the app if there were more “rewards” or “challenges”. It IS there, but not as exciting. Other than that, the UI is SUPER clean and intuitive, cross connectivity with Apple health is seamless, and is a very straight forward experience! I can’t wait to use this with the scan watch!!!

title: Too soon; too many adds
text:
So far the monitor seems to work OK if I can get past all the advertisements.  It gets stuck cycling on downloading adds, quitting the download, and starting another download until I quit the app! I am about to go back to my old one of a different brand that did not have a network interface. 
Start up, “Do like our app?”, later, find devices, cycling, shut off .... Start up, “Do like our app?”, later, find devices, cycling, shut off, start up, “Do like our app?”, later, find devices, cycling, shut off, start up, “Do like our app?”  .....

title: Cool Scale
text: I got the Nokia scale made by Apple to use with this app. I think it’s okay so far, you just have to keep in mind it’s sensitive and takes time to adjust to your body. I gave it 3 stars for that reason, not that it’s a bad one, just frustrating. You have to be patient with the data processing in the beginning it will more than likely be extremely off therefore, you have to weigh yourself periodically to get a accurate measurement. I’m up to 3x a day but the scale is starting to get used to me. Again, It’s very sensitive.

title: Love the Data!
text:
The way the data is presented make it really easy to understand what your body is doing. Sometimes your weight will fluctuate widely, but looking at all the other data really helps show the progress that you can’t see just by looking at weight.

I’d love to be able to stack the graphs besides just weight to a specific one.

Keep it up and love the new dark mode features!

title: Won’t continue to display
text:
I use this app daily and suddenly in the last couple of days it won’t stay open. I open it and it displays for a few seconds and then closes automatically. Shut down my iPhone and tried again but it auto closes in seconds. Kind of makes the app useless if I can only us it for 10-15 seconds. 

This has been a GREAT app until this. Hope they fix this quickly so it can be again. Love my Withings devices. The app needs to be the same quality.

title: Blood Pressure Cuff
text: I’ve had this for a few months but am finally starting to use it. I was out of town for a few months and didn’t have room in my suitcase to bring it along on the plane. Upon going to the doctor and having my blood pressure taken in his office, my pressure is comparably lower there. So what I plan to do on my next doctor visit Is to take it with me and see when my blood pressure is taken there, he’ll check this one for accuracy. So really I don’t know how the accuracy is. It wasn’t cheap.

title: Decent with lots of opportunities for improvement
text: I just purchased the body+ scale and each member needs to install the scale to their downloaded app, which isn’t an optimal experience. Not sure why the entire setup (including WiFi, etc) needs to be done each time. Also, I was surprised with the lack of integrations. Would like to see MIRROR, Peloton etc added. Even if they are not added as a direct integration, these apps are integrated with the Apple health app, so would love to see that workout data pulled in. Thank you!

title: Sad.
text:
1. On account creation, passwords can not be pasted from Dashlane. Security is therefore not a priority at all. Why should it be, its just health related information we are talking about here...

2. It took 3 attempts to pair scale and phone, several restarts of both devices, my wifi wasn‘t detected. This was normal in 2010, in 2021...maybe just give up.

3. 30 mins in everything about using the app and the scale is a dysfunctional mess. There are companies that get the user experience out of the box done, this is not one of them. Unfortunately I will have to keep trying for a lack of alternatives. If that wasn’t the case, this product would go right back.

title: UPDATE: GPS stops working mid run
text:
Original review below. They fixed for a little bit then rolled out an update that made my most recent run ruined with disconnect issues. Please please test your functionality on all devices before rolling out. This was purchased to simplify my workouts, not complicate them.

Old review: This used to work perfectly but I haven’t gotten an accurate mileage reading on my last 9 runs. Got done with a 3 mile-ish run today and it says I ran 0.47 miles. 

Aside from the app, my scale still constantly changes units. I’ve stuck through two company changes and am left with two defective products and zero support.

title: App works great but Sign In with Apple does not
text:
I created my account using “Sign In with Apple” and easily connected my new Body+ scale. The scale and app work perfectly. 
What doesn’t work is connecting other apps to the Health Mate app. When I try to do so, I’m taken to a Withings webpage with no option to “Sign in with Apple.” 
The end result is I have to either start over by creating a new Withings account and losing my history or give up on linking to other apps. Withings, please add The Sign In with Apple feature to your web login!

title: It just keeps getting better
text:
Using my Apple Watch, the Withings scale, My Fitness Pal, and the Withings app I've lost 32 pounds in 3 months. 

I have been struggling with up-and-down weight loss for a long time. I finally feel like I'm going to be able to get to the goal weight that I have set for myself.

You have to update every single day and pay a lot of attention to the calories that you take in but if you do it you will lose weight!

title: Fixed
text:
Update:
I deleted the app, signed out and in, reconfigured my scale, and a few days later my new data started appearing. Not sure what was wrong but it’s working fine now!

My app seems to be stuck on November 24 and isn’t fetching any new data from my scale, despite showing my scale as connected and up to date. When I open the app all I see is a Black Friday promotion that ended over a month ago, and none of my measurements since Nov 14

title: Love this app and their products! However...
text:
Heart rate monitor is not stable on iPhone 13 pro. Most of the time the camera lens is unable to read my heart rate. It seems that the lens is too sensitive. When you place your finger on it with medium force, the app is saying to "gently place my finger", but when I place it gently, it's not reading my pulse altogether.
Please fix this.
Otherwise, this app is amazing! Keep up the great work!💪🥰👏

title: Doesn’t always work with iPhone 11 Pro Max.
text: Have trouble getting software to go to start with my iphone. Never I had problems with iPhone 7 or 8.  Must use my iPad to start process to get recordings.  After getting readings they to do show up on iPhone 11 in Health mate app.  No problems in getting readings from Withings Body Cardio scale to iPhone 11.  Support has been fast to respond but problem still exists.  Hope this is fixed before (if ever) the bpm Core is FDA approved.

title: Great app, well integrated!
text:
I’ve been using the same well made Withings scale since 2010, long before I was tracking anything with an app. As the app has evolved, taken over by Nokia, and now back on course, it’s just gotten better and better.

so I don’t just use the app for weight, I also record blood pressure in the app, albeit manually from a BP machine I already own. One thing I would ask to add, is an option for recording ketones (mmol/L), blood glucose (mg/dL), hemocrit percentage, and hemoglobin (g/dL).

These are numbers I track multiple times per day, and currently use another program to do so. I would love to further centralize my collection of this into Health Mate!

Anyhow, thanks for keeping such a great ecosystem of devices, apps, and data running smoothly!

title: iPad Landscape
text: I have been using this app since 2010.  I have 2 scales & the BP checker.  Love this app on the iPhone, I especially like the fact that I keep track of my family stats.  I’ve seen my kids grow up with this app.  I track their weight as they grew up.  I just wished I did the same for their height.  The only thing preventing me from giving it a 5 star is on the iPad, Landscape mode doesn’t work.  I have to keep twisting it sideways to use it on it.

title: Weight Gain/Loss
text: Decades my weight climbed up unchecked. Now retired and focused on getting healthy, it took about 3 years to reach the Mayo Clinic’s suggested BMI. My wife’s gift of a FIT and a friend’s health condition/advice have me focused EVERY DAY, 50-60 miles of walking each week mainly in the Indiana Yellowwood forest area. Also: “Go Vegan!” Dr Caldwell Esselstyn’s book: “Prevent & Reverse Heart Disease” is your path to a longer healthier life. I have bought and given away over 20 of his books to family & friends, getting expensive!!! Ha!

title: Good App But Does Not Link with MyFitnessPal
text: Good App. Works well with the Scale purchased from the Apple Store. Pulls steps from iPhone. But, does not link properly with MyFitnessPal app on phone, i.e. does not pull nutrition information and does not reduce number of calories per day, accordingly, despite AppStore advertisement touting this app links with MyFitnessPal app ... 8 email exchanges with customer service (not available by phone) and still not resolved.

title: So many glitches
text: I was super excited about this app, but i will weigh myself in the morning and then, without even stepping in the scale again, a couple hours later the app will tell me that I’m 10-15 lbs heavier than my weight that day. It will still show my regular weight, then show a second weight that is absolutely wrong. I have to deleted the second higher weight at least 8 times a day because it keeps coming back. This is incredibly annoying sense my passion is health and fitness and I rely on this app to show me a good measurement and graph of my weight.

title: Good quality devices overall, backed by so so software
text:
Withings scales are great, but the software still has no means to note if the weigh ins are before or after a meal, or with or without clothing, a critical detail. And there’s no way to calibrate the scale if you have extra long, large, or flat feet, which appear to really throw off the water & fat measurements.

The blood pressure cuff works more than half the time, they’ve removed the ridiculous 10 step checklist you had to go though, but it could be a lot simpler to use. 

The sleep tracker I stopped using because it was recording over thirty hours sleep per day. The support people are useless, it’s always the owners fault. And apparently it can’t distinguish between people and pets and it decides when you get to see the sleep data, not you.

The thermometer was great, but apparently it can become uncalibrated over time and there’s no mechanism to reset it, and for some reason, the results require a seperate App.

And so on...

title: There must be someone in Withings who can beta test?
text: A reasonable program was modified to make it not only non-functional but to quickly eat any battery one has.  I could say more hasty things but why?  I used to like Withings and I hope they can recover good health.  Today it did one better and the BP functionality disappeared from my iPhone. Health app.  Go figure the players at Apple and Withings.  They appear to be hellbent on dipping to the lowest denominator.

title: Great App that adjusts to you
text: Great app. Love that it helps you understand what actual weight loss is, not water loss or gains. Helpful reminders to eat fruit and hydrate. Gives you a nice chart to show you what you want. You can pick and choose a lot of different things to benefit your goals on the app. One thing I would like to see is tacking my hydration levels from day to day. Maybe it’s already there and I’m missing it? Anyways, great app! Strongly recommend!!

title: Great scale!
text: This scale was given to me as a gift, and I use it daily. The two features I find most useful are the weight tracking and pulse monitoring. The initial set up took a lot of patience, but was well worth the effort. All questions I had were answered on the web. I love being able to track my weight and heart rate on my iPhone, and am considering purchasing the blood pressure monitor as well.

title: Sleep record never correct
text: I got this 2 1/2 years ago for an alarm and to record my sleep. At first it worked. After about 6 months it didn’t work and wouldn’t connect so I stopped using it and only used the light. I reset it about 3 months ago and downloaded the new app. It worked for a week and now the sleep record consistently is wrong- it shows that i was awake throughout the night for hours or just stops recording after 2 or 3am. I tried to move it several times and also made sure it was placed correctly. I am about to give up again and just use it as a light.

title: Do NOT buy watch & this App
text: I bought a Withings activite’ watch about 22 months ago and used it with the Withings app before acquired by Nokia. While it had a few glitches with differentiation of exercise, it was otherwise really fast & accurate. This Nokia app is FAR inferior. It takes forever to load. The sleep readings are no longer accurate and I’m ready to completely abandon this watch which was given to me by cherished friends. I’m very sad because I love the look of this watch and the band options!

title: Sleep Tracker
text: I use the under mattress sleep tracker and so far I am very pleased with the product and data collected overnight. There is a direct correlation to my sleep score to how I wake up feeling daily which leads me to believe the under mattress mat is actually effectively tracking the various readings it takes overnight. Overall, highly recommend this product over the Apple Beddit product mainly due to amount of data collected and sleep score. Nice work!

title: Aura
text: We have been using the complete Withing system for years; scale, app, tracking watch, and aura sleep tracking. Since Nokia has bought out Withings, most of these have various problem. Not liking the new app design. In addition the aura sleep tracking has not worked right since the changes. As of late it shows that we sleep at times that we are not home and doesn’t record any time that we are sleeping.

title: New update causes issues syncing data
text: The app used to track my steps and heart rate info. Something must have went wrong with the last update because it’s not pulling that information over from apple health anymore. I have verified that the app is still authorized to read that data under “sources” in the health app. It does give an option to “Start tracking your activity” in the dashboard where my activity info used to be shown. That wasn’t turned off, so it should’ve be necessary to turn it back on. Tapping that takes me to a screen that says “steps tracking activated” but doesn’t do anything or mention heart info either. Too bad.

title: No HealthKit support
text:
The UI is adequate and it reads Withings devices. However, there is no support for HealthKit. 

The readings from the withings devices should be written to the HealthKit database so it can be referenced by other applications. 

Seems a no brainer.

—————————-
Modification. This is now March 2018. All info from Withings scale and blood pressure machine posts to HealthKit.

One missing piece. There should a way to force the app to take a blood pressure reading. At this point, the only way to do this is turn on the blood pressure machine and wait for the app to detect that the machine is on. Then it takes a reading. Once the reading is taken, and the app returns to the main screen, there is no way to force another reading. One has to wait for the blood pressure machine to turn off first, then turn it back on.

title: Health mate scale
text:
I love the scale. I have had it about 3 years. I had to reset it 1 time, that was a little bit of a pain trying to get it to hook up to blue tooth watch tracker but the watch was an older tracker other then that it works great every time I use it. I like that the reading goes to the app and keeps track. 
Withings is a good company great customer support. Their tracking watches are on point with steps walked too.

title: Now useless for Withings products
text: Like others I’ve noticed that support for Withings products has been cut out. I have a Pulse Ox that despite doing a factory reset as Nokia told me to do and other assorted things it still will not automatically sync as it once did. After seeing someone mention their BPM having issues with the app I tried mine and can confirm mine does too. As I told Frank from Nokia after trying all his ideas for fixing my Pulse Ox sync issue, once I wear out the button on my unit from having to manually sync every day I’m done. I like the Pulse Ox because I can keep it in my pocket since I’m hard on watches and also can’t see them due to being visually impaired.

title: New version by Nokia takes the fun out of weight loss
text: The graph for weight tracking has changed with the new version that came out since the Nokia acquisition, and has lost all the detail and functionality the previous version had. The colors are dim and the averaging curve is so smoothed out that any day-to-day achievements are barely perceptible. I’ve lost 10 pounds in 6 weeks and wish I could get the satisfaction of daily achievement with my withings scale, but it’s now a waste of time. I might have to buy a Fitbit scale and be done with this nonsense. Clearly after months of App Store complaints Nokia is not going to do anything about it. Weight loss in the digital age is supposed to be fun.

title: Avoid product. Does not sync, perpetually stuck loading
text: I bought the BPM Connect a few days ago and it uses this app as the companion app. I’m very disappointed and would caution against both the app and the products associated with it. Aside from the initial measurement made during setup, I have not been able to successfully log further measurements. The only thing that happens is that the app perpetually says “loading” above Latest Results. I’m sending this product back and asking for a refund. More problems than it’s worth. Trying to get it to work is just going to drive my blood pressure back up.

title: Doesn't Receive Text Notifications on IOS
text: I depend heavily on text notifications and was recently forced to replace  my last HR steel due to a fogged up lens. Now I can't get text notifications to work on my IOS device. Support couldn't help me except to say "they're working on it". this product has been out for years. Why did I not have the problem on my old device but now support can help to get it working. So disappointed....

title: App lacks features compared to website
text:
Overall the app is good in terms of what it does. The main reason for giving it 3 stars is that App does not provide all functionality that their website does. 

For instance, I have two users under my account. And sometimes the weight gets assigned to wrong person. Website allows me to reassign it to another user. App does not. So, I am forced to use their website and defeats the purpose of having app on my phone. 

Also, I have given my app write permission to apple health data. If I delete any measurement from the app, it does not delete it from apple health. I need to go and do it manually to keep consistent data across two locations. 

These are two examples of obvious features missing from the app. I am surprised that developers writing this app did not encounter them and fix them. May be they don’t eat their own dog food.

title: Best Health Tools!
text:
I have been using the WiiThings product lines for many years as well as the Health Mate app; before the Nokia acquisition and now back.  
It is the best comprehensive set of integrated health tools I have found.  I am sure you can find cheaper tools but I don’t think you will better tools that work seamlessly together for a comprehensive look at your health.  They all well worth the investment.

title: Very slow to update from scale
text: I bought the scale to track my weight and see it on my phone. Sometimes it takes days or a week to update on my phone. I weighed in 4 days ago and checked the app for the last 3 days and it showed my old weight. This mourning I got an email showing my weekly report. The new data was shown in the email . Opened the app, still showed old data. 3 hours after getting an email with the correct data, the app finally updated.  If there is a way to force the app to grab the new data please let me know.   Love the idea of the app, Hate the extreme delays.

title: Missing part of sleep data in Health app
text: This app used to work fine. But with the recent updates, sleep data is no longer properly synced from the Health Mate app to the Health app. For example, only part of the night is synced and some parts are missing. I see 7-8 hours of sleep in the Health Mate app but only 3-4 hours in the Health app. I look at the data source and data points and see that some time windows are missing, some are duplicated. I have reinstalled multiple times, but it does not help. According to their version change log, this issue is supposed to be fixed already, but it is NOT.

title: Lots of little issues recently
text: Insights have broken links to webpages with extra details and videos. You cannot unsubscribe from Insights from the current Insight on the Home screen (the action doesn’t work), you can only hide the current Insight. You also can’t leave the Leaderboard program - I have no one to compete against, and I can’t leave the program so it stops displaying on my Home screen. And why was the app version 5.2 notification delivered to me in Chinese?

title: Worth IT!!
text: I never write reviews for any apps. But this app and its scale is amazing. I have the Body+ scale and it helps you motivate in weight loss for sure. The nice thing is when I don’t see a substantial weight decrease, I know it’s because I’ve gained muscle and lost fat! That helps a lot in comprehension when it comes to weight loss as muscle is so much more dense than fat. On normal scales, you don’t see that. Here, you see it all.

title: 5.0 Version is a bit glitchy
text:
Blood pressure scale SYS is always on far left. When you delete the record interface is jumpy and not smooth like previously.

Not sure don't like that when I open the app it is non on the timeline.

Overall 5 stars for the app, but also maybe 3.5 because they don't import sleep from Apple health so my Oura ring data is not present here.

title: I enjoy this app very much so, but did you remove indoor running and indoor cycling?
text: I just uninstalled and reinstalled my Health Mate app and tried to configure my Steel HR Sport, prior to the uninstall I had the option to set my workouts as indoor cycling and indoor running. Not I just have running and cycling as options, I like to set indoor while working out inside as it does not use the GPS function and it would also let me look at that data vs the times I do run outside. Can you please add this feature back.

title: Heart Rate data issue
text: I’ve had the Steel HR for several days, and the app seems to work fine for the most part, but even though I have all the syncing permissions turned on in Apple health and in the Nokia app, the heart rate data does not sync with Apple Health, and in turn, none of the other health apps on my phone can access any of the data either. This is extremely frustrating. I have double checked everything and I have done a lot of research to try and find a solution. All of my settings are correct, and everything that should be turned on is on, yet the data is only visible in the Nokia app. Please fix this issue in the next update.

title: Good but Keep Improving
text: The scale and the app work well together to measure your body fat, muscle mass, weight, and other data you select, some of which usefulness is dubious; bone mass or water weight for instance. But you can select which ones you want and ignore the rest. What prevents me from giving the app five stars is that the user interface scrolls too easily sideways when you may want it to go up and down to see all your data.

title: Crappy syncing
text: For whatever reason, the app won’t sync with my Apple Health data for a 6-day stretch in the middle of this month.  That I can’t delete my profile and set it up again — or at least not easily because you can’t remove the main user on the account — just makes it more annoying.  I don’t find this app particularly useful and wouldn’t use it at all except it’s apparently the only way I can port my Apple Health data to my employer’s wellness site to earn reward points.  Otherwise, I don’t see how this is different from the app that comes with whatever fitness device you’re wearing.

title: Innacurate heartrate data Steel HR + need more features
text:
- At the gym, I compared the HR data wearing both Apple Watch 1 and Steel HR with the gym machines and manually checking my pulse after/during workout. I found that Apple watch is way more reliable and accurate (~160bpm after a good sprint and Steel HR displays 110bpm!). I hope there is an update soon to fix inconsistencies!

- Please add on Steel HR watch+app outiside temperature at assigned/current location. It's really nice to check the weather outside throughout the day on my wafch.

- Need more watch notifications apps like reminders, Microsoft to-do, etc

title: Bad experience for multiple profiles
text: The scale is cool and has great features but it’s a big mess when my wife and myself use the scale. The weights get mixed up. I looked up online on how to reassign the weight on the website which the app doesn’t allow which is weird. But even after reassigning the weight on the web, the app still shows the wrong weight for my profile. The other issue is now whenever I stand on the scale, it shows an X for the profile. What does that mean?

title: Does not work in landscape mode.
text:
This app is very good, BUT it doesn’t display in landscape mode.  It would gain more stars it it did.  On the iPhone it doesn’t matter so much.  Using the iPad it is critical as the iPad is used mostly in landscape mode.

Also it should have a history of the Heart Rate.  It has a history of the blood pressure and the body weight (and body fat), but not the heart rate.

title: Great app, watch and scale
text: I own a Withings watch and scale so the app is a must.  I am very pleased with the data the app provides.  This app is easy to navigate and helps keep me on track for my health and fitness goals.  I do recommend this if you are looking for ways to gain a better understanding of your vitals.  The watches offered by Withings look like traditional watches which is good enough for an old guy like me.

title: App error
text: When I try to record an activity, there is no way to exit the screen after recording. I got stuck, I had to delete the app and reload it again, just to get out of that screen. I thought it was maybe just my I phone, but I had my husband try it also and the same thing happened on his phone. He has a Samsung S20+.

title: My Scale is Off
text: I’ve was using this app for a couple of months and I can honestly say I loved it, but have now slowed down on weighting myself because my scale is inaccurately weighting me. I’ve been to two different doctors office for different reasons and of course they weighted me. Both offices said the same thing. I would use my scale and it’s either off by two pounds or more than on some days. I put the scale all over my house to get the correct measurements, but still getting the wrong readings. Maybe it’s my apartment building, I don’t know

title: App is improving
text:
App has been vastly improved since the terrible first Nokia revision of the old Withings app. Still not quite as good as the Withings version, but much improved. The online instructions for using the app still do not match what is actually in the app(for example, using a scale with more than one user). 

The online Nokia Health portal, on the other hand, is excellent, and far better than the old Withings online portal.

Overall I’m happy with the direction this app is going. Can’t wait until it’s a true 5-Star app, as the hardware remains excellent.

title: Perfect for Tracking
text: I have been weighing myself every day for the last 4 days. I can see trends based on what I eat. One evening I ate a very salty dinner, the next morning my weight was up but it was up in “water weight”. This definitely was good for keeping me motivated and not feeling bad because of an increase in overall weight. The next day my weight was down and I can see the body fat percent dropping a little each day.

title: Why not just HealthKit?
text:
The app is meh. Nothing to write home about. Nothing cutting edge. Really I just don’t want to deal with it all! Especially the sign up/in part!

I want a device that I just connect to my iPhone and dumps reading to HealthKit. I don’t want you to have my data. I hate all the health devices that want our data! And I’d be happy to pay more for that!

HealthKit is well engineered for privacy. I’d rather only have to worry about the one versus all these other companies in addition too. I’m actively seeking the device manufacturer who understands this. And you better bet I’m dropping you ASAP when they show up!

title: Overall this app is helpful, but needs some improvements.
text: The app is very convenient and has a very nice presentation. However, the product is usually incorrect, and does not show many of the occurrences that happened throughout the night. Also, there is no average of your usual sleep schedule so it is difficult to show data to doctors. Overall this app is helpful, but needs some improvements.

title: Malfunctioning watches and horrible customer support
text: I’m on my second special edition HR Steel. The product has too many issues to catalog and customer service gives you the run around. I’ve wasted hours on hold (it’s almost impossible to get a phone number) and more hours writing back and forth with reps who are responding from a script and not answering the question. All I wanted was a functioning watch. The time on the face never matches the digital time. It stops functioning all together and then I’m told to wait weeks for an up date. I’d like a refund but it’s never offered. Don’t buy this product!

title: Great- and help with this, Whithings!
text:
Great app. 

Some small important improvements for me...

- the way you calculate weight loss for a month seems inaccurate.  Somehow the weight between monthly transition days seems counted incorrectly- or not counted at all.  This causes my monthly readings, which are important to me- to be useless.  Help!

-  My biggest problem is me.  Occasionally I will fall off the “weight myself everyday” (or for others, it may be a different time period) wagon.  You have my permission to create a “nag me” function if I stop weighing in.  You can even make it completely obnoxious so that I would rather weigh in than encounter the reminder.  
I know that’s on me.  But you might be able to help there.

title: Red flags everywhere
text: There’s no way to send feedback to the developer (which on its own is a sign of a bad app) so they’re getting a bad review here. On the graph view of my weight, no matter how many times I turn the “target weight” display setting off, it still comes back every time I restart the app. It’s a really annoying dotted line that squishes the graph way up to the top and I want it to stay off until I get closer to my target. This is such a simple issue that should have been caught by basic QA. I would have preferred to contact the developer directly with this issue, but couldn’t find a way to do that from the app or their website.

title: Poor Sleep tracking
text:
So far everything else seems ok but the sleep tracking is awful.  I literally have been waking up each morning at 4-6 am in extreme back pain, tossing and turning, going from each side to my back, etc., until I finally give up and get out of bed. The app doesnt catch the tossing and turning and shows me still in sleep. Kinda frustrating when im hitting an extreme each morning like this and it doesn’t register. 

I dont yet have enough comparison data to review the steps and exercise data.

title: Love this scale and app
text: We’ve had the scale about 2 years and love it. It tracks our progress integrates with our Apple Watch and blood pressure monitor to get a comprehensive view of our health. It tells us happy birthday and happy New Years! The only issues we’ve had is a couple of times it couldn’t recognize us, and sometimes it doesn’t register our vitals.

title: Nice App and one request
text: My withings scale finally died so I bought the upgrade, which is the fully loaded scale which provides a lot of data on weight trends and even the weather for the day.  The only question I have is if the developers would please recognize readings (steps), etc. from the fitbit app.  This would be very helpful in rounding out the experience and maximizing the Nokia Apps true potential.  Thank you.

title: Good but could be better
text: I enjoy this app and use it with a Pulse HR, scale, and the BP cuff. It doesn’t offer all the features I would like it to but I like the simple layout. This last update seems to have messed with something because all of a sudden I’m getting random activities showing up in my feed. Swimming, cycling, and walking for 10-30 min at odd times. I really hope the developers fix the bugs and maybe bring some new feature soon.

title: Non intuitive interface
text: Features are hard to find here (like “alarms” buried under “device”). Also, this $200 device is meant for women too, but it does not allow us to track our menses and correlate other data with it, like sleep quality or weight. You don’t need to be a woman to understand how tracking hormonal changes may help you anticipate changes in other aspects of your body and allow you to plan ahead. You guys integrate with 3rd party apps. Why not one that offers this feature? I know making hardware  is hard, but this is basic stuff guys.

title: Miss the original set of features
text:
All many of us ask is for the original purchases restore our software. Otherwise pleased 

Downgraded my scale 

It would be acceptable if the changes applied to those that purchased the scale as of a certain date. The Cardio was very special and unique and the initial buyers were generally patient as it improved. It was expensive and beautifully made with a unique set of features. Hoping that it will go back to its full featured set of measurements one day. Still very disappointing what happened to my scale your removing features we paid for. 

I was there from the beginning. The old app interfaced better. I bought the BPM+. I have the original and I expected more. My Omrons use a different more comfortable method. At its price one expects much more. It reading a little high on average when compared. Hopefully firmware will improve the product as appreciate in general what has been done.

Update hopeful that the features will be restored.

title: Best fitness app - with style!
text: I’m entering my 11th wearing my Withings (now Nokia) Steel HR and very pleased with its functions and performance paired to the Healthmate app. I also have a paired Nokia scale so am nicely monitoring and managing towards my fitness goals. The app sets goals and tracks most every performance parameter you could want. And did I say the Steel HR doesn’t look like a fitness strap but rather a very stylish 39mm watch (with text and phone notifications!). Flawless performance.

title: Lots of bug fixes, a few still there
text:
Finally, heart rate history will show data beyond one month! Really happy that this has finally been fixed. However, a few bugs are still present:

- Showing heart rate history as a table does not work.

- Exporting heart rate history, the “send to your doctor” option, also doesn’t work.

I don’t use the above two often.. but for a device that is a heart rate tracker, it’s disappointing that some heart rate features are still not functioning... particularly since they were working just fine before the rebranding from Withings to Nokia. 

The interface is slick, but functionality is what I’m after - I’d really like to see this app at the full capability it once had.

title: Updating previous review
text: Newest update fixed my prior issues. Thanks to devs for taking care of an issue that many of us were having with missing data in Apple Health. The app now integrates with Health seamlessly again. This is a great app for tracking health daaa, especially when paired with Steel HR. Looking forward to the new products and functionality of newer devices.

title: BUGS, as far as the eye can see
text: It is kind to give this app two stars. Imagine your frustration when this happens; You hike all day, accruing some 16,000 steps. You go home, open the app to sync your steps, and magically the app deletes the steps from your watch (back to zero!) and only gives you credit for the 300 or so steps you took at 8 am that morning. This experience is par for the course with this app. It’s not much help when you’re earning $ from work for your steps and don’t get credit because the app can’t seem to translate from the watch. I’m ready to go back to my Fitbit.

title: Great products!!!
text: I was fast approaching 300lb and was saying to my self, no way. I use my iPhone and another app to track what I eat so I decided to better watch my weight I’d get a scale that allowed me to track my weight easily. I got the WI-FI scale. Took 5 min to set up. Within weeks I was weighing in at 255, 249 and I got excited. The ease of seeing the app up to integrate with Apple health isn’t funny.

title: Pretty good
text:
The watch works pretty well, but the crystal fogs up when it’s warm or you’re doing activity often. The watch is very energy efficient and only needs charging every 10 - 14 days, unless you’re using it often to track workouts. 

With the recent updates it tracks biking very accurately without any eliciting. I bike commute every day and it’s nearly 100 percent accurate. It doesn’t track your heart rate unless you prompt the activity feature.

title: Not an ethical company
text: Only interested in new business.  You can’t use the product with the current software release on the MacBook - only continues working when the new chip product becomes available.  No possibility to exchange the chip on the MacBook to satisfy the Withings company.  Company only seems to care about themselves and don’t care to support the product to be at all usable by existing customers.  Very expensive product for a device that only serves to provide a small platform about an inch off the floor to stand on.  Not clear why anybody would need that.  I certainly don’t.

title: Needs better display of activity data
text: I like the watch and scale but am still disappointed with the app.  I’d really like to see a better interface to display activity data.  Should include trends and averages along with weekly, monthly and yearly totals with averages.  As it is the activity tracking is pretty worthless other than to show metrics for 1 workout.  Pretty disappointing given that the data is saved but they just don’t display it in a useful way.

title: Move watch
text:
I like how my watch tracks my sleep.  Not to keen how it tracks my walking by being attached to my wrist.  There are times when my hands are full and I am carrying stuff and no seeps get recorded.  But I am considering up grading my watch if I could find a good deal.  Seeing I am retired and living on social security I need to watch expenses.
What would the next watch upgrade be?

title: Frustrated
text: I've never been a huge fan of this app.  It's not all designed for troubleshooting and issues. For example, my weight has not been synced to the app in for days now but there's no way in the app to understand why.  I've reset the wifi and that's seems to work as indicated in the scale (READY) but it still doesn't sync. Arg!  I think I'll need to do a complete reinstall of the app and reset the scale.

title: Love It!
text:
This app and equipment are great! They tells you about you water, muscle, fat, weight, and BMI.  These are great resources for monitoring my child’s weight due to some disabilities. We are using an iPhone or iPad.
She says it is helpful to tell me to know about the water amounts and the other things I need to know to stay healthy. I recommend the product because it allows me to set health goals.

title: Very very Satisfied
text: This scale does exactly what it says! I love the fact that you can see all of your measurements through the app. I am able to watch my progress on my journey to a healthier lifestyle. I use the app on my iPhone 8plus and it is a God Send. I would definitely recommend this to anyone in the market for more than just a regular ole scale. Top of the line product!

title: Poor user interface
text: User interface is not designed well. It’s clunky and not flexible. Also have to provide full name and email for every user. Another issue it asked for my weight to set up my profile, but I bought the scales to measure the weight which I had not done yet. I entered the weight from the doctor’s office last week but it recorded that as my measured weight for today. I can’t find a way to edit it to the right date or to delete it. The software is just not well designed or intuitive.

title: Lazy watch
text:
I love the look of the withings move, so I can wear it anywhere anytime and it looks casual chic not athletic arm plastic. But this thing is lazy! It does not record steps anywhere near accurate unless you manipulate your stats for weight and height to unrealistic measurements. Even then you’re lucky to get 66% in range of real steps. Tested against leading fitness tracker multiple times. Withings lags behind like a lazy puppy. 
Sometimes like a lost dog as it frequently fails to find device when 6 inches from phone during a sync attempt. 
Would love to see a software update that makes me want to write a 5 star review!

title: NOT Syncing with iOS health.

title: Why?
text: The app worked fine and now this new version forces the user to see uninvited “advice”. Why is this ugly green window at the top if my screen forcing me to answer all kinds of questions that are none of your business? Please remove this ugly green window soonest. It stops me from using your app. Allow the user to freedom to decide if they want the uninvited “advice”, do not force it on the user with no information to stop it.

title: Keep it up
text: Love the app my watch and the scale , all work right on point, it’s been a great experience to enjoy every day, more important is to see the results immediately after finishing exercising, the only hick-up that I fiend is my scale do not give the exact steps for the day always on the screen is the day before, any ideas why is that? Thanks and “KEEP IT UP “

title: LOVE IT!!!
text: I have struggled to lose weight for several years (11) after my son’s birth. I tried Lindora 2x and Weight Watchers 3x. I could never keep the weight off. However, with this scale/app plus my Apple Watch I have lost weight and kept it off for over 6 months. The watch tells me how many calories I burn (can eat) and weighing every morning and tracking (graphing) my weight with this app is a great double check!!!

title: Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn’t
text: Love the portability of the cuff and that it can feed results directly into the phone so you can track how you are doing. Great for travel.  I have the 0434 model according to the tag so it’s s couple of years old but lately have been getting “failed” just as it gets to the end of where it should be taking the reading.   Also it is battery dependent and does not have a power adapter.  Great when it works, frustrating when it doesn’t.

title: Crashing since update
text:
I actually give it 3 stars.
I recently updated to latest version.  Now app crashes/shuts down soon after opening.  Help?!!
Plus, every name I try to use for review is “taken” and will not allow me to submit.   I’ll try increasing the rating to 5 stars and see if it allows me to send. 
But truthfully, I’m only giving it 3 stars.

title: Almost perfect
text: Great app, especially when linked with one of their scales that automatically records your data, but there's one thing they could do to make it even better for those times when you're having to manually input your data when using a different scale:  don't reset the fat % back to zero every day! You don't do that for the weight, so why do it for fat %? Please make that simple fix. You'll get your 5th star!

title: Love this app
text: This app is perfect.  Very easy to use and accurate.  Been using it for the last year or so.  I’ve lost 22 lbs. in a few months.  Thanks to Withings’s I’ve been able to see what needs to be done to hit my goal.  I’m very pleased with my results and how I can keep track and record all my personal info.  Highly recommend Withings Scale and the app.

title: Very pleased!
text: I was sent a Withings scale as part of a diabetes prevention program in which I am a participant. I am very happy with this product and love the fact that my weight is automatically recorded everyday when I step on the scale and is sent directly to my health coaches. Also, I tested the scale for accuracy and it perfectly lines up with another scale that I already had.

title: Easy to use
text: I have had my Withings watch for a number of years. I love that it just measures a few things like heart rate, sleep, and steps and doesn’t have so many functions you can’t master it. I only have to charge it every three weeks or so. It has an analog face and a handsome design. I’ve tried other wristwatch health monitors. I just come back to Withings.

title: Just love my Withings!
text:
Tracking my weight every morning helped me to control it. I use with my Apple IPhone and I wish you could further improve the interaction between both systems. Although it has some interaction. And if I could track my sleep quality with my Apple Watch and Withings it would be great. 
Thanks for continuous improvements! 
Regards

title: Enjoying
text:
I’m loving this over the fit bit. I love the ease of syncing info. I’m using the pulse, walking, sleeping, and swimming. I have no complaints. On occasion it recognizes a new activity. I haven’t figured out what it is or what to do with it. 
I hate the wristband. It’s hard to get a snug fit and a true pain to close. I get my granddaughter to help. 
It does what I need and I’m thinking king of adding the scale and blood pressure. 
For the price, it’s perfect!!

title: What the heck?
text: Just got it as a birthday gift from my son. I wonder if he can return it. I just want to know my weight. I really don’t believe the data on water percent and bone weight, etc. How can the scale tell all that from me standing on it w bare feet?  In the course of setting it up I got three different weights!  How is this better than my normal digital scale?  I really didn’t like entering all my information into the app. Why can’t my weight be private?  I normally enter my weight into my Excel spreadsheet and graph it. Where can I do this w Withings Body?  Are you trying to do too much w a simple scale? Don’t like it.

title: Nokia-Withings product still disappoints
text:
Four year-anniversary coming up in November and our Withings WS50-94 Smart Body Analyzer still can’t reliably transmit weight and other readings because it routinely loses (and cannot re-establish) contact with owner’s iPhone 7S Plus and/or iPhone 6S Plus every time we leave the house (and WiFi network).

Who has time to re-pair their Nokia devices daily, troubleshoot engineering issues or establish an ongoing relationship with tech support? No explanation, no fix, no follow up, no customer satisfaction. This product has been massively disappointing, especially under Nokia. We might as well have bought a scale connected to the 1970s.

title: Battery difficult to change and BPM unreliable

title: Perfect app

title: Extremely frustrating

text: I have been using the app for my scale for about a year. I started using it with my watch about a month ago. I was hoping to use it to better track my indoor rowing (#Hydrow loving it!). title: Beautifully simple

To those especially finding beauty in simplicity! Hope all can enjoy it as much as I have.

title: 2 YEARS & STILL WAITING! WTONG!
text:
This company has a great watch, scale, etc.

title: Buggy
text: As for measuring blood pressure the app does its job. But, counting my steps is tricky as it adds the same steps measured by my Apple watch, which doubles my distance in the health app. This happens because the app writes the steps data with the time of pressure measurement which is different from what the watch wrote. title: Worked a couple of times that’s it.
text: I bought this device excited for Bluetooth enabled bp. Worked great for 90 days. Then failed every time.  Support sucked so badly that I finally gave up and went back to manual.  I finally just threw the pice of junk in recycle bin.  If you have arms over 14 inches. Stay away from it. You’ll be eating the cost of purchase.

title: Great promise(s); disappointing delivery
text:
I purchased this device because of the purported ability and ease of sharing my BP readings with my primary care physician. However, despite multiple attempts in different ways and hours of trying, it has never actually worked (even though the app indicates that the data have been sent).

If I were to do this all over again, I would very likely purchased a different device.

title: Pretty much useless
text:
Firstly, the scales refuse to sync to my phone. When I finally got it working with my iPad, I found out that THERE IS NO PRIVACY MODE. You cannot sign up without giving away your private medical data and you can’t sign up without accepting email marketing. 

This is totally disrespectful of their customers. I don’t care what data policy they have, the remote chance that your private health data gets into the wild and into the hands of the insurance industry is a bridge too far. 

Going back to my normal scales which do the job intended when they whisper in my ear: “Here’s how much you weigh.”

title: Amazing!!
text: I’ve used a Garmin smart scale before and it was such a poor experience! Data would never sync to Apple Health after a few months (I bet they don’t expect people to actually use their products). I bought this new scale and haven’t had a single problem! The data even syncs to Apple Health in the background! Amazing. Amazing. Amazing.

title: Super easy and great equipment
text: When I first got this I thought I would use it a bit and that's it. Just when I felt like. But now I want to keep track of my health for blood pressure and temperature as the information goes to my doctor. The blood pressure app allows you do an advanced which takes 3 readings and gives you the average. Good stuff if you want to keep track of your health

title: Customer Disregard
text:
Despite the device quality generally being very good, the company doesn’t seem to know how to connect to their customers or fix even the simplest software defect. 

There has been a problem with their programs for nearly 6 months and release after release to the App Store has produced  NOTHING. Repeated emails to support have seemingly been ignored other than the myriad of canned responses like “I apologize for the delay. Please know that our development team is already working to release a new program in a few weeks.”.

As a software professional it’s hard to imagine how this can be allowed to happen. Most of us would be out of a job with this kind of defect resolution rate. The more problematic issue is the company’s seemingly uncaring attitude towards users. No one answers the many comments about the same problems in the Withings forums. Not a single escalation during months of emails about the defect.

And time marches on...

title: You can't change what you don't track
text:
I ❤️ health mate. It's a great way to track my progress as I make improvements to my body over time. It helps keep me motivated seeing changes on a daily basis. 

My only gripe is that I think the bloody fat calculation is a bit off - it says I'm 10% but I have a feeling I'm probably closer to 17-18% . Fortunately it's still a good way to see that I'm losing fat so there's that.

title: Best scale

title: Needlessly complicated

title: Raises my blood pressure
text:

title: Everything I need in a watch!

text:

title: Can’t live without Withings Products
text: We have the scale and 2 pulse HR trackers. They provide important feedback for our health with weight, sleep, and activity monitoring! In the rare occasions when we need help with our devices the support team is patient and persistent until a solution is reached! title: Got the scale for the advanced features, fell in love with the app

text: Recently noticed a discrepancy between my resting and active calorie totals between the Apple Activity and Health apps. text: Since Nokia took over, the chart is no longer useful. title: Living in an era where we don’t own anything
text:
This app is another reminder of the perils of buying anything that includes apps or digital content.   I bought this scale over a cheaper version because of the pulse wave velocity feature.  Now Nokia has removed it from the app, crippling the feature.  I understand that home measurement tools for things like body fat and pulse wave velocity might not be true and accurate measurements,  but using the same measuring tool and methodology at least gives a way to track relative improvement 

Nokia should give us back the scale features we paid for,  or offer a refund.

title: App repeatedly crashing with no fix
text: The app has always worked perfectly, but starting today, it crashes within 10 seconds of opening. I made sure all data was saved online, deleted app, reinstalled app, and it’s doing the same thing. This app is currently unusable for iOS. Beware.

title: Bad connection setup
text: I bought this scale 3 months ago and it worked fine at first. But all of a sudden the new weights wouldn't log and I haven't been able to reconnect the scale to my phone. Several people have tried to figure it out. I deleted the app and reinstalled it, plus factory reset of the scale. Nothing worked.

title: Mrspepe
text: As yet I don’t understand all the features. I was checking my sleep pattern and several days have no data. Hello! I sleep every night with a CPAP. Also, I don’t understand how it counts steps. Apparently I need to have the phone on my person all the time. It is a nice watch. Sometimes if the light is poor, I cannot read it. But I’m old. I do like that it tells me when I have a message.

text: The app is nice, but recent updates have caused my Withings scale to drain its battery much faster. It takes 4x AAA batteries, and it’s using them up almost weekly. It used to last months! It appears to be connecting to the internet relaying info nonstop, instead of just when I’m on the scale. title: make it 5 stars!
text:
update:i discovered the partnership with myfitnesspal and all i can say is not a fan of their app. way too cluttered and unappealing. a lot of people like it but not for me. if you don't build these features into your own app (best) at least partner with other popular meal trackers like fitbit and myplate too. 

I would really like to see this app add dietary intake and water intake like the fitbit. its annoying to have to use a 2nd app. please upgrade! then id give 5 stars

title: aesthetically pleasing & gets the job done
text:
The app is overall alright. Nothing groundbreaking, but gets the job done. I use it mostly as a way to sync my data to Apple Health.
It looks beautiful though.
There is this chat bot. It's a nice feature. Sometimes the bot says very interesting and relevant things. But very often it just keeps repeating itself.

title: New look post Nokia has less usability
text:
Unable to “zoom out” on my aggregate blood pressure views to see changes over long periods of time. This was useful for showing benefits of exercise routines, diet changes...seeing the downward trend in a high contrast, colorful, easy to read format.

Now we have artsy barely-there lines, can’t zoom out, and the max I can seem to view at a time is monthly, as though that points out sort of meaningful trend? 

Style over substance here. Please ask yourself “what are people doing with their data? How are they looking at it? What long term trends indicate changes in health, and can these be discerned in our app?”

title: Fundamental to my life
text: I couldn’t live without this watch, app, and scale.  It has become a fundamental part of my everyday life and it has helped me greatly through major health recoveries.  As a part of my daily ritual, it has made me a much healthier person.  I sleep better and I adventure outside for steps much more than I would naturally.  Health Mate is amazing.

title: Heart rate is not accurate
text:
When I run with the watch. The heart rate accuracy is terrible. It shows the max heart rate is only 130 while Apple Watch I have been using always show very accurate heart at 165.

I wish Withings can really make the sensors more accurate, so it is meaningful to use . Otherwise, it is no point to buy it after all.

title: Excellent app, great with Steel HR and scale
text: It’s excellent. Everything works as expected but for one item. I am giving it four stars due to lack of workout calories burned not syncing with Apple Health. I want a comprehensive way to manage calories burned within the ecosystem I use and that include MyFitnessPal, which in turn reads from Apple Health workout calories burned. Currently, only calories from the pedometer feature from my Steel HR is counted.

title: Pretty good, has data inconsistencies
text: App is nice for what I use it for, tracking weight and body composition. It has a data inconsistency bug though. Say I weigh in, my new weight shows up on the chart, but then if I look again I only see yesterday’s weight, but maybe today’s BMI shows up. It seems to be eventually consistent, but I can’t understand why it takes so long. A few doubles is not too hard to write to the backing data store.

title: Too Hard to Communicate Feedback
text:

Please fix and provide easier feedback process 👍

text:

title: Looks pretty, needs work
text: The app looks pretty but there are some infuriating aspects that need work. For example, you can view your weight by month, quarter, or year. The graphs are all fairly useless as they don’t have good axis lines. Everything seems to be designed to look glossy but are not actually usable.

title: Simple but effective
text:
Great app to collect all your activity data with out cluttering the page. Syncs well with steel HR and body + scale. 

A couple of feature updates can make this the perfect wearable. The battery life is amazing and I would trade some of it for continuous HR monitoring rather than the 30 minute intervals. A average HR after workouts would be nice. Lastly, a bit more detail into sleep tracking.

title: Great but need more meal logging option
text: So far, loving the app and devices. I purchased a cardio body scale, to replace my Fitbit scale, and the bpm. title: Awesome App for Self-counters

text: I like everything about this app but the weight line chart zooming is incredibly frustrating. title: Useless for fitness
text:
