text: Battery life could be longer and batteries could be cheaper. Have to get a new one twice a year and they cost $15 each time. I’ve had my watch two years and use it for everything and it’s super scratched - could be more durable. Wristbands don’t last very long, I need to get a new one every six months to a year. A great watch but some darn costly upkeep !!

title: Can’t log workouts anymore
text: I’ve used this app for years and liked it, but during the last 4-5 months nearly every update has caused some failure or glitch. This is very frustrating. To be brief I’ll only detail the most recent frustration: since the last update I can no longer log workouts. That is, I add all the data—activity, start/end times, effort, calories, and SAVE—and the workout vanishes from the app as if I’d logged nothing. Please fix. And stop “improving” this app!

title: 1 star
text:
Until the Withings devs put in an option to lock the weight unit measurement, I am giving this app one star.  Scale can’t handle humidity, and constantly changes the unit of measurement if exposed to it.  It’s also a pain to change back since the button on the bottom end usually takes forever to respond to pressing it.

Don’t bother sending me to support.  I don’t want a coupon to use on a new scale that’s just going to do the same thing. Fix the defect already.  Other people have brought this issue up over the years so you should be WELL AWARE of the problem by now.

title: Cannot connect to Steel watch after app update
text: A week ago I updated the app to the latest version, ever since then the app does not sync with the watch for steps and sleep. I tried replacing the battery, did the factory reset, reinstalled the app, reinstalled the device, logged in and out the account, literally everything the web says and nothing works. The worst part now is that my phone cannot even detect the watch, with that I cannot change the time nor wear it. Hope somebody can do something about this, I’m sure not the only person messed up by this update.

title: Better
text:
I’ve been using this app and products before Nokia took over. They’re really really trying.
Bugs are getting slowly fixed and the new design seems to have finally settled in a stable state. I’ll give the team five stars so they don’t lose hope. There honestly isn’t a good alternative to these products so I hope Nokia doesn’t throw In The towel.

title: Why change a good thing?
text: How could you change Withings system To nokia like this?... withings was a pleasure to look at and use. It had a black background and the charts were amazing. I could see a day or month or year of progress. Just like yahoo finance. If you wanted to improve withings please go ahead... but what Nokia did was to delete all of it and take us back to 1999. I like the wireless BP system and I will continue to use this app for this but... go look at the old withings and consult with some doctors and customers with heart problems. The most disappointing app change I have ever faced. Just a fact.

title: Crashes on startup
text:
This app was fine for the many years I’ve used it. After the latest update, it crashes every time I try to open it. Please post the previous version as an “update” so we can have the functionality we paid for back.

Update: the latest version fixed the crashing issue. Thank you!

title: Don’t Update!
text:
After I updated to the current version the sleep tracker no longer syncs. I have tried starting, resetting and starting all over again but the data no longer goes from the sleep mat to the app. The scale still works with zero issue I now have a newer mat that no longer works because of the update and, I guess, will now be used as a inflatable backpacking sleeping mat for my cat.

By the way, support so far has been bad. They only direct messages my to the support page to try to find an answer. Pathetic.

title: Old version was 10X better
text: The new version of the app, where the whole look has changed is useless. The old version would let you know when you have achieved a weight goal or a step goal. It would be like a landmark on your timeline. You can see it and feel good about achieving a goal. This version does nothing, you just see you daily stats. The achievement does not show up on your time line, even if you achieved your weight goal. There is no incentive to use the app what so ever. I miss the old app, it was 10x better. Will have to find another app that is more useful.

title: Confusing
text: I really want to like this app but it's confusing. I log in, it gives me info but it’s days old. Then even after I refresh, the same. A few days later, it gives an update.m but the daily info isn’t there. I want immediate information. Can’t figure this out. Frustrating

title: Doesn’t Work
text: I bought the Withings Body+ scale to get more measurements than weight alone. It doesn’t work. It can’t measure my body fat or composition. The BMI seems to be calculated from height and weight alone, which I could have done myself. It’s also wildly inaccurate. The online support forums are out of date and not helpful. This is worse than body composition scales that existed twenty years ago. It does know the weather, but maybe they should have figured out the body related features before moving on to useless things for a scale to do.

title: Trouble with app shutting down before fully loading data
text: I have been using this App with my scale with no problems for a little over two months.  Today I opened the app to use my scale, and every time I open the app it shuts down before fully loading anything.

title: Unreliable and disappointing
text: Worked great for one person for a few days all measurements were gathered by simply stepping on the scale and synchronized to the app daily. Never worked for other household members. Quit working reliably for all users even after numerous attempts to configure. Seems to pair with wireless just fine. App seems to be of poor quality scale seems to have quit working in the first week. Regardless of how we position our feet it will no longer take and synchronize anything other than weight.  This is a disappointment

title: Excellent body and sleep measurements
text: Captures BMI, body fat and weight from the scale. Also tracks steps on the phone but not other exercises.  Should get credit for cycling 30 miles but don’t...Need to add other exercises to count towards daily goals not just steps.  Should capture data from other apps through the health app. Would make it more useful.  Use and love the sleep sensor.

title: App & Scale
text:
I use the app with a scale and could not be happier. The top features I like are being 
 able set what information displays on the scale screen and seeing my husband’s information in the app. 

Tracking my data has helped with my goal of improving my health, and the app and the scale ante great tools. 5 stars from me.

title: Best scale to use with Apple Health / iPhones
text: After trying Renpho and Fitbit first, I am just so happy with this scale. It was easy to setup, it doesn’t require me to have my phone on me with an active Bluetooth connection to the scale (Renpho does this) to get data, and it quickly and automatically shares the data with Apple Health on my phone (Fitbit does not).

title: Doesn’t sync up to date
text:
It constantly stops syncing up to date with all the Upgrades
I haven’t seen body fat on the app in months, as well as muscle mass or water content
Oh I get steps but that’s meaningless to me.  What are all the effects of steps, no idea
Click all buttons in the App, it just doesn’t happen.

title: Top notch fitness tracking
text: I have been using this app since the Gen 1 version of the Withings wearable.  Each upgrade of the app (and watches) encourages more focus on aspects of health.  Only recommended update:  after day 1, add a rolling summary of heart rate, blood pressure, sleep, and total step count to help drive motivation through the week.  Thanks!

title: Write Permission
text: This is a great app, however, since app changed from Withings, the app has not have the write permission to update weight data in Apple’s health app. Because of this other apps does not get updated with the most up to date weight information. It would be great if the app can have the write permission to update weight data for Apple’s Health app again.

title: Would or could have been a new customer
text: After reading your reviews for over an hour, hoping that it would improve with the settling in after the company’s turnover, I’ve decided not to invest my time or money in any of your products or services. You can’t turn a blind eye and really believe that your way of doing business is in any way going to be productive. Unless that was always the plan. Buy the company, take the loss and use it, run it and it’s ability to compete for some specific reason. Then auction it off after shutting it down. It’s classic hostile takeover.

title: Sign-in fiasco
text:
Tried sharing a scale with another user. The link takes her to a page that requires she login with an email and password, except she signed into the app with her Apple ID. 
The link does not redirect to the app nor does it allow Sign-in with Apple ID. 
Very frustrated over such a simple development error. FIX IT.

title: Scale great for weight, but app has issues
text: My main problem is the app, not the scale. I like the scale and what it can do is enough so I ignore the fact that it’s very inaccurate in measuring steps. I tried to find out how they determine number of steps to no avail. Impossible to talk to a person, just keep meandering through help pages until I gave up. So I’ll keep the scale as I’m happy with it. I’ll find another way to monitor steps.

title: Withings Scale
text: I love this scale!!  The app has never failed me, it’s very accurate and syncs right to my phone every time. If I could afford their watch, I’d buy that too. With the Covid-19 pandemic going on right now, that’s not in my budget. Thanks to this app for keeping me updated and offering additional information to keep me motivated and informed.

title: Doesn’t actually track sleep
text: It seems like the app has gotten worse. If I get up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom, or get a drink, it is done. I’m no longer sleeping that night. It’s not an interruption. It’s done. When I check the. Ext day, even if I “Edit My Night” it just shows the time as edited and doesn’t track any information it should have still collected. If that simple thing was fixed I would rate the app and the sleep tracker much higher.

title: Activity tracker and app are not in sync
text: This app is what was listed for the activity tracker I purchased. My app displays the amount of steps I took as 4827. The actual amount I took which is reflected on the Apple health app is 9024. That’s a major difference especially since my job gives incentives based on the amount of steps that are recorded. I bought the tracker so I won’t have to carry my phone at all times. But if I would have known the tracker and the app were not in sync I would have saved my money and just kept carrying my phone.

title: Almost worthless
text:
App crashes constantly. You will need to restart your phone 2 or 3 times just to open it each time. Even then, most of your data cannot be viewed because if you try to open it, the app will just crash instead. 

The app wants you to set location permission to “always allow” for running. They have programmed the app to inexplicably not work if you set location permission to “while using”. There is no reason for this other than the creator wants to gather location data.

title: It was such excellent app
text: The more you add to this the less useful it became. To get my data I need to spend 20 min to find it. Now I need to throw my scale in the garbage. I spent 3 hours trying to connect it to IPhone X.  One of those devices need to be sacrificed. I am choosing your scale and blood pressure monitor. What is the point to have them if I cannot see any data?

title: Frustratingly inept technology
text:
For the following reasons this scale should not be on the market and needs a total technology overhaul:

1. Virtually impossible amount of time to synchronize scale to phone
2. Repeatedly unsynchs to my otherwise very reliable internet 
3. Horrible graphics on phone, again is virtually impossible to navigate or understand
4. Inexplicably changes randomly from lbs to kg which then is time consuming to change
5. Takes forever for weight results to appear on my iPhone 
6. Impossible to navigate from info screens
7. Cost of scale was prohibitive relative to other scales on market and based on above is obscene. 

Please get your act together and fix issues above. This is a scale, for goodness sake, easy and fast access to one’s weight should not be this frustrating and futile. 😡

title: Does not play well with others
text: I like to use a wireless scale as I have great difficulty seeing at times.  I purchased this scale when it was “Withings” and it interacted well with most of the food-logging/weight reduction apps I have. Since it was sold, it has slowly stopped sharing its information to the point that it currently will not share information with the Apple health app!  As soon as it dies, I’m searching for a wireless scale that will simply record my weight and disperse it to the apps that I want to have access to my weight.  I really don’t need to know the air quality in my bathroom.

title: Great app, great company, great customer service
text:
Excellent to see rapid improvements to the app after getting freedom from Nokia. Great integration with Apple Health, awesome updates to the Steel HR. As a family we have two Steel HRs, a Body+ scale, the BPM+ and a Thermo. 

Only one reason you still get 4 stars: the Thermo has only limited functionality in the Health Mate app. Please, please fully combine Thermo into Health Mate. I don't want two apps!

title: Update: “Withings killed it this year” —Wired
text:
Withings must have the most clueless or most diabolical marketing people in the business.

That’s the quote they put in their latest marketing email.  We don’t want to buy bricks.  Now that Nokia is out of the picture, do the right thing, and bring back the the PWV feature, even if only for educational or amusement purposes.  I can correlate with my own CIMT or CAC scan every year, and this will let me see if I need to get a scan early.  By withholding the feature, you are causing your ex-customers distress and potential damage.

Back to the original review:
I had a perfectly good scale.  I upgraded to the Withings scale for only one reason: it had a pulse wave velocity feature.
Then along comes Nokia, and they take the single feature away.  Why? Not proven?  Not accurate enough?  Work on the firmware, and add a disclaimer.  I will never knowingly buy ANYTHING from Nokia again.

title: Loving it
text: I use this APP everyday to monitor my health trends and to motivate me to make healthy choices. I have been using this APP over 3 years now and It is great to see where I have been and where I hope to go in the future. The graphing interface is clear and interactive and the database that I am building is my personal story of my road to better health. Thank you

title: Add more Activities for tracking workouts
text: I use this with my née scale. I was trying this app out for activity tracking while out on SUP wanted to track distance, speed and time. Can you add Stand Up Paddle-boarding with GPS tracking as a activity type to the list??? That would be an nice addition.  Thanks

title: Can no longer connect to Devices from IPhone
text:
I have been using HealthMate for years with a Withings blood pressure monitor and digital scale.  I can no longer connect to either device via Bluetooth. 

I performed all the troubleshooting items listed on Nokia’s website. Ever since I disassociated both devices from the app, forgot them in Bluetooth settings, and restarted phone, the app hangs on connecting to device and never competes. 

The new app from Nokia is now useless for my needs. I can not longer use my trusty Withing devices.  Nokia please fix Bluetooth connectivity issues immediately.

title: Beautiful design
text:
I have been using the smart watch and app for a year or so now. I love the way everything looks and feels. I primarily track my sleep and my exercise as a casual everyday human. I have no complaints! 

I hope it doesn’t get any more expensive 🤞especially as I keep buying new watch bands!!

title: Excellent customer service
text: I’ve used the withings scale for many years. When I encountered a problem syncing the scale with my phone, I received excellent customer service. The IT support folks were very patient and persistent in solving my problem. No issues since then. Use this daily and love it!  Great purchase.

title: Love It
text: The Steel HR Sport is an absolutely fantastic fitness tracker and smart watch for people who value simplicity over function. All I wanted was a slick watch with a traditional watch face that also functioned with a fitness tracker and let me read texts, and that’s what this is. The app is also easy to use, tracks all kinds of data and is smartly designed. Great experience from Withings.

title: Nice app overall
text: I like it. Strong sides: keeps track of the whole family, shows pick performances, notifications are logical and not annoying, they actually support you on your goals once in a while. Downside: I have a feeling the muscle mass is just calculated based on the fat %, it is not a real measurement, the muscle mass grows proportionally every time you drop some fat, even without muscle building activity.

title: Excellent app, needs ability to share workouts with health app
text: The app is great for tracking steps, sleep, activity, and heart rate, especially if you ha e other Withings ecosystem items. The only gripe I have with the app is that while it uploads a ton of info to the health app, it doesn’t upload workout information. This is a significant shortfall for an app making the claims this one does. If workouts fed into health app this would be 5 stars.

title: Sad
text: I was so excited about this scale! It worked for a few months and then lost its connection to my phone. I can not reconnect it no matter what I do. If I ever do get it connected again, all data will be lost and I won’t have proof of the 20 pounds I have lost. Unfortunately, it’s not worth the money and needs more research to fix the tech glitches.

title: Good
text:
1:Would like it if read steps from other sources,not just iPhone and Apple Watch.
2.Would be better if it supported auto workout detection when using the app itself.
Update:3.Please support an idle alert on your devices and the app itself. 
4.Also when I delete steps from Health app it doesn’t delete in health mate. How and why?Please fix
5.Why not support sleep tracking in-app via Apple Watch Health Data?Maybe even a smart alarm and automatic sleep tracking.

title: Much Improved
text: I use this iPhone app with the Nokia scale and Steel HR watch. I was very disappointed with it after the rebranding- mostly due to the changes to the graphs, especially the weight chart. The latest version has come a long way towards restoring the past performance, and in some ways is even better. Keep up the good work.

title: 5 stars for a different reason
text: I own a Withings scale and blood pressure monitor. However, I use an Apple Watch for fitness tracking. I also track my blood sugar in another app. The common denominator: Apple Health. On the web and my iPad, HealthMate allows me to review my stats. Until Apple makes the Health app for iPad and macOS, I’ll stick with HealthMate.

title: Best Scale!
text: Everyone in my house uses the scale and it knows who’s who. It never confuses and if we are close in weight it will display names for us to make sure it’s reading the right person. It send my results automatically to my phone so I can see my progress. Beat investment and highly recommend!

title: Smart Body Composition Scale
text: I’m unable to change the kg to pounds. Can not change the cm to inches. I’ve done the steps with pushing the button on the back so many times, I could just puke. Makes me resign into the internet each time. Does not show me kg or pounds. Shows me the picture to start all over. Cannot get in touch with any tech support person. Just articles. Done the article at least 10 time. Ugh!!!! Hate the customer service and tech support. Absolutely no help!!! Going send the product back if this is not resolved.

title: At last, an elegant fitness watch and solution
text: I am very active but I need a watch I can wear every day, all the time. That includes work, and I dress relatively formally. I’m not going to wear a bulky gizmo and I don’t want another device that’s always on the verge of needing to be recharged. I wear it on two week surf trips and with a suit. That’s my kinda watch.

title: What’s Wrong with Health Mate
text: I have been using this app earnestly for 1 year and today it keeps shutting down after it launches, within seconds. I even deleted it and reestablished the app hoping that would correct the issue-no luck. Is this app still receiving developer support? Appreciate any follow-up.

title: Love the blood pressure features and storage.
text: I’ve had the blood pressure cuff and program for years and it’s been great.  You need to turn off the Bluetooth in anyone’s phone who’s been using it in a given household so it will differentiate the user.  I love being able to show my doctors my blood pressure numbers as they always get a much higher reading in the office.

title: Easy to use
text: I’ve been using this app since 2016 & have seen a lot of changes over the years. I like the dashboard & ease of accessing information & trends. I would like to see more personalized trend data- perhaps daily morning messages that give you a rundown of your weekly trends, things that are improving, and areas to focus on. I like the email digests, but it’s not enough useful info for me.

title: Broken after last update
text:
Crashing right after being open. Started to crash after last update 5 days ago. Don’t you guys test new versions??? Apparently not good enough
Updated 9/14: installed last update which fixed the crash. Also got response from support which was nice. Of course, better no crash at the first place, but quick fix is appreciated.

title: Rough Start but So Far, So Good
text:
It took forever to pair the scale with the app!  First called Withings to help.  I stayed on the phone with them for 2hrs (I’m not exaggerating)!  Then I called Apple Support (I bought it from Apple) to help me!  Finally, we got it paired!  I like the features!  I’m having problems linking to MyFitnessPal app.  I wish LoseIt app could connect instead. 😒
It has GREAT POTENTIAL to be a GREAT APP!  Please fix the bugs in your app, add LoseIt app and then I’ll give you 5 stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Good product
text: So far so good. We have three family members using this. All of us are about 20 - 25 pounds apart. It’s only assigned a weight to the wrong person once and we’ve been using it about 2 months now. I would like to know if there’s a way to manually add an oximeter reading to this. With covid, many of us are now monitoring our oxygen levels also.

title: Customer Service........WHERE IS IT?
text: Customer Service was really a big problem. I had a lot of difficulties in the beginning and couldn’t get it synced. Nevertheless months and a new phone later I got it working properly. This was not the result of any Customer Service but in spite of it. Once I got it going I loved it. There are questions I would like to ask but I know there is no one to help so I won’t be wasting my time.

title: Awful connecting and bad user experience
text: We bought this scale 2 times and both times we had an issue to install it. Then one day it disconnected me completely and I couldn’t connect this scale back to my phone. Also to navigate in the app is very hard. Hard to understand what is where in this app. You really need to test your app with regular people. I am disappointed, I wish Apple store doesn’t sell products until it really works.
